    2300             : 
    2301             : /*
    2302             :  * \brief Determine what, if any, CC has been offered and queue a CC frame if possible
    2303             :  *
    2304             :  * After taking care of some formalities to be sure that this call is eligible for CC,
    2305             :  * we first try to see if we can make use of native CC. We grab the information from
    2306             :  * the passed-in sip_request (which is always a response to an INVITE). If we can
    2307             :  * use native CC monitoring for the call, then so be it.
    2308             :  *
    2309             :  * If native cc monitoring is not possible or not supported, then we will instead attempt
    2310             :  * to use generic monitoring. Falling back to generic from a failed attempt at using native
    2311             :  * monitoring will only work if the monitor policy of the endpoint is "always"
    2312             :  *
    2313             :  * \param pvt The current dialog. Contains CC parameters for the endpoint
    2314             :  * \param req The response to the INVITE we want to inspect
    2315             :  * \param service The service to use if generic monitoring is to be used. For native
    2316             :  * monitoring, we get the service from the SIP response itself
    2317             :  */
    2318          68 : static void sip_handle_cc(struct sip_pvt *pvt, struct sip_request *req, enum ast_cc_service_type service)
    2319             : {
    2320          68 :         enum ast_cc_monitor_policies monitor_policy = ast_get_cc_monitor_policy(pvt->cc_params);
    2321             :         int core_id;
    2322             :         char interface_name[AST_CHANNEL_NAME];
    2323             : 
    2324          68 :         if (monitor_policy == AST_CC_MONITOR_NEVER) {
    2325             :                 /* Don't bother, just return */
    2326          68 :                 return;
    2327             :         }
    2328             : 
    2329           0 :         if ((core_id = ast_cc_get_current_core_id(pvt->owner)) == -1) {
    2330             :                 /* For some reason, CC is invalid, so don't try it! */
    2331           0 :                 return;
    2332             :         }
    2333             : 
    2334           0 :         ast_channel_get_device_name(pvt->owner, interface_name, sizeof(interface_name));
    2335             : 
    2336           0 :         if (monitor_policy == AST_CC_MONITOR_ALWAYS || monitor_policy == AST_CC_MONITOR_NATIVE) {
    2337             :                 char subscribe_uri[SIPBUFSIZE];
    2338             :                 char device_name[AST_CHANNEL_NAME];
    2339             :                 enum ast_cc_service_type offered_service;
    2340             :                 struct sip_monitor_instance *monitor_instance;
    2341           0 :                 if (sip_get_cc_information(req, subscribe_uri, sizeof(subscribe_uri), &offered_service)) {
    2342             :                         /* If CC isn't being offered to us, or for some reason the CC offer is
    2343             :                          * not formatted correctly, then it may still be possible to use generic
    2344             :                          * call completion since the monitor policy may be "always"
    2345             :                          */
    2346           0 :                         goto generic;
    2347             :                 }
    2348           0 :                 ast_channel_get_device_name(pvt->owner, device_name, sizeof(device_name));
    2349           0 :                 if (!(monitor_instance = sip_monitor_instance_init(core_id, subscribe_uri, pvt->peername, device_name))) {
    2350             :                         /* Same deal. We can try using generic still */
    2351           0 :                         goto generic;
    2352             :                 }
    2353             :                 /* We bump the refcount of chan_sip because once we queue this frame, the CC core
    2354             :                  * will have a reference to callbacks in this module. We decrement the module
    2355             :                  * refcount once the monitor destructor is called
    2356             :                  */
    2357           0 :                 ast_module_ref(ast_module_info->self);
    2358           0 :                 ast_queue_cc_frame(pvt->owner, "SIP", pvt->dialstring, offered_service, monitor_instance);
    2359           0 :                 ao2_ref(monitor_instance, -1);
    2360           0 :                 return;
    2361             :         }
    2362             : 
    2363           0 : generic:
    2364           0 :         if (monitor_policy == AST_CC_MONITOR_GENERIC || monitor_policy == AST_CC_MONITOR_ALWAYS) {
    2365           0 :                 ast_queue_cc_frame(pvt->owner, AST_CC_GENERIC_MONITOR_TYPE, interface_name, service, NULL);
    2366             :         }
    2367             : }
    2368             : 
    2369             : /*! \brief Working TLS connection configuration */
    2370             : static struct ast_tls_config sip_tls_cfg;

    2372             : /*! \brief Default TLS connection configuration */
    2373             : static struct ast_tls_config default_tls_cfg;

    2378             : /*! \brief The TCP server definition */

    2389             : /*! \brief The TCP/TLS server definition */

    2450             :                 /* An empty string is not a token. */

    2724             : /*! \brief Check if the authtimeout has expired.

    2739             : 
    2740          47 :         timeout = (authtimeout - (now - start)) * 1000;
    2741          47 :         if (timeout < 0) {
    2742             :                 /* we have timed out */
    2743           0 :                 return 0;
    2744             :         }

    2748             : 
    2749             : /*!
    2750             :  * \brief Indication of a TCP message's integrity
    2751             :  */
    2752             : enum message_integrity {
    2753             :         /*!
    2754             :          * The message has an error in it with
    2755             :          * regards to its Content-Length header
    2756             :          */
    2757             :         MESSAGE_INVALID,
    2758             :         /*!
    2759             :          * The message is incomplete
    2760             :          */
    2761             :         MESSAGE_FRAGMENT,
    2762             :         /*!
    2763             :          * The data contains a complete message
    2764             :          * plus a fragment of another.
    2765             :          */
    2766             :         MESSAGE_FRAGMENT_COMPLETE,
    2767             :         /*!
    2768             :          * The message is complete
    2769             :          */
    2770             :         MESSAGE_COMPLETE,
    2771             : };
    2772             : 
    2773             : /*!
    2774             :  * \brief
    2775             :  * Get the content length from an unparsed SIP message
    2776             :  *
    2777             :  * \param message The unparsed SIP message headers
    2778             :  * \return The value of the Content-Length header or -1 if message is invalid
    2779             :  */
    2780          49 : static int read_raw_content_length(const char *message)
    2781             : {
    2782             :         char *content_length_str;
    2783          49 :         int content_length = -1;
    2784             : 
    2785             :         struct ast_str *msg_copy;
    2786             :         char *msg;
    2787             : 
    2788             :         /* Using a ast_str because lws2sws takes one of those */
    2789          49 :         if (!(msg_copy = ast_str_create(strlen(message) + 1))) {
    2790           0 :                 return -1;
    2791             :         }
    2792          49 :         ast_str_set(&msg_copy, 0, "%s", message);
    2793             : 
    2794          49 :         if (sip_cfg.pedanticsipchecking) {
    2795          49 :                 lws2sws(msg_copy);
    2796             :         }
    2797             : 
    2798          49 :         msg = ast_str_buffer(msg_copy);
    2799             : 
    2800             :         /* Let's find a Content-Length header */
    2801          49 :         if ((content_length_str = strcasestr(msg, "\nContent-Length:"))) {
    2802          47 :                 content_length_str += sizeof("\nContent-Length:") - 1;
    2803           2 :         } else if ((content_length_str = strcasestr(msg, "\nl:"))) {
    2804           2 :                 content_length_str += sizeof("\nl:") - 1;
    2805             :         } else {
    2806             :                 /* RFC 3261 18.3
    2807             :                  * "In the case of stream-oriented transports such as TCP, the Content-
    2808             :                  *  Length header field indicates the size of the body.  The Content-
    2809             :                  *  Length header field MUST be used with stream oriented transports."
    2810             :                  */
    2811           0 :                 goto done;
    2812             :         }
    2813             : 
    2814             :         /* Double-check that this is a complete header */
    2815          49 :         if (!strchr(content_length_str, '\n')) {
    2816           0 :                 goto done;
    2817             :         }
    2818             :

    2820           0 :                 content_length = -1;
    2821             :         }
    2822             : 
    2823          49 : done:
    2824          49 :         ast_free(msg_copy);

    2826             : }
    2827             : 
    2828             : /*!
    2829             :  * \brief Check that a message received over TCP is a full message
    2830             :  *
    2831             :  * This will take the information read in and then determine if
    2832             :  * 1) The message is a full SIP request
    2833             :  * 2) The message is a partial SIP request
    2834             :  * 3) The message contains a full SIP request along with another partial request
    2835             :  * \param data The unparsed incoming SIP message.
    2836             :  * \param request The resulting request with extra fragments removed.
    2837             :  * \param overflow If the message contains more than a full request, this is the remainder of the message
    2838             :  * \return The resulting integrity of the message
    2839             :  */
    2840          55 : static enum message_integrity check_message_integrity(struct ast_str **request, struct ast_str **overflow)
    2841             : {
    2842          55 :         char *message = ast_str_buffer(*request);
    2843             :         char *body;
    2844             :         int content_length;
    2845          55 :         int message_len = ast_str_strlen(*request);
    2846             :         int body_len;
    2847             : 
    2848             :         /* Important pieces to search for in a SIP request are \r\n\r\n. This
    2849             :          * marks either
    2850             :          * 1) The division between the headers and body
    2851             :          * 2) The end of the SIP request
    2852             :          */
    2853          55 :         body = strstr(message, "\r\n\r\n");
    2854          55 :         if (!body) {
    2855             :                 /* This is clearly a partial message since we haven't reached an end
    2856             :                  * yet.
    2857             :                  */
    2858           6 :                 return MESSAGE_FRAGMENT;
    2859             :         }
    2860          49 :         body += sizeof("\r\n\r\n") - 1;
    2861          49 :         body_len = message_len - (body - message);
    2862             : 
    2863          49 :         body[-1] = '\0';
    2864          49 :         content_length = read_raw_content_length(message);
    2865          49 :         body[-1] = '\n';
    2866             : 
    2867          49 :         if (content_length < 0) {
    2868           0 :                 return MESSAGE_INVALID;
    2869          49 :         } else if (content_length == 0) {
    2870             :                 /* We've definitely received an entire message. We need
    2871             :                  * to check if there's also a fragment of another message
    2872             :                  * in addition.
    2873             :                  */
    2874          23 :                 if (body_len == 0) {
    2875          21 :                         return MESSAGE_COMPLETE;
    2876             :                 } else {
    2877           2 :                         ast_str_append(overflow, 0, "%s", body);
    2878           2 :                         ast_str_truncate(*request, message_len - body_len);
    2879           2 :                         return MESSAGE_FRAGMENT_COMPLETE;
    2880             :                 }
    2881             :         }
    2882             :         /* Positive content length. Let's see what sort of
    2883             :          * message body we're dealing with.
    2884             :          */
    2885          26 :         if (body_len < content_length) {
    2886             :                 /* We don't have the full message body yet */
    2887           2 :                 return MESSAGE_FRAGMENT;
    2888          24 :         } else if (body_len > content_length) {
    2889             :                 /* We have the full message plus a fragment of a further

    3272             : /*! \brief maintain proper refcounts for a sip_pvt's outboundproxy

    3275             :  * by the proxy parameter. Because proxy may be a refcounted object, and

    3568             : /*! \brief returns true if 'name' (with optional trailing whitespace)

    3580       27971 :                 !strncasecmp(sip_methods[id].text, name, len));
    3581             : }

    3779             : 
    3780             : /*!
    3781             :  * \internal
    3782             :  * \brief Transmit SIP message
    3783             :  *
    3784             :  * \details
    3785             :  * Sends a SIP request or response on a given socket (in the pvt)
    3786             :  * \note
    3787             :  * Called by retrans_pkt, send_request, send_response and __sip_reliable_xmit
    3788             :  *
    3789             :  * \return length of transmitted message, XMIT_ERROR on known network failures -1 on other failures.
    3790             :  */
    3791        2916 : static int __sip_xmit(struct sip_pvt *p, struct ast_str *data)
    3792             : {
    3793        2916 :         int res = 0;
    3794        2916 :         const struct ast_sockaddr *dst = sip_real_dst(p);
    3795             : 
    3796        2916 :         ast_debug(2, "Trying to put '%.11s' onto %s socket destined for %s\n", ast_str_buffer(data), get_transport_pvt(p), ast_sockaddr_stringify(dst));
    3797             : 
    3798        2916 :         if (sip_prepare_socket(p) < 0) {
    3799           0 :                 return XMIT_ERROR;
    3800             :         }
    3801             : 
    3802        2916 :         if (p->socket.type == AST_TRANSPORT_UDP) {
    3803        2883 :                 res = ast_sendto(p->socket.fd, ast_str_buffer(data), ast_str_strlen(data), 0, dst);
    3804          33 :         } else if (p->socket.tcptls_session) {
    3805          33 :                 res = sip_tcptls_write(p->socket.tcptls_session, ast_str_buffer(data), ast_str_strlen(data));

    3846             : /*! \brief NAT fix - decide which IP address to use for Asterisk server?
    3847             :  *
    3848             :  * Using the localaddr structure built up with localnet statements in sip.conf
    3849             :  * apply it to their address to see if we need to substitute our
    3850             :  * externaddr or can get away with our internal bindaddr
    3851             :  * 'us' is always overwritten.
    3852             :  */
    3853         773 : static void ast_sip_ouraddrfor(const struct ast_sockaddr *them, struct ast_sockaddr *us, struct sip_pvt *p)
    3854             : {
    3855             :         struct ast_sockaddr theirs;
    3856             : 
    3857             :         /* Set want_remap to non-zero if we want to remap 'us' to an externally
    3858             :          * reachable IP address and port. This is done if:
    3859             :          * 1. we have a localaddr list (containing 'internal' addresses marked
    3860             :          *    as 'deny', so ast_apply_ha() will return AST_SENSE_DENY on them,
    3861             :          *    and AST_SENSE_ALLOW on 'external' ones);
    3862             :          * 2. externaddr is set, so we know what to use as the
    3863             :          *    externally visible address;
    3864             :          * 3. the remote address, 'them', is external;
    3865             :          * 4. the address returned by ast_ouraddrfor() is 'internal' (AST_SENSE_DENY
    3866             :          *    when passed to ast_apply_ha() so it does need to be remapped.
    3867             :          *    This fourth condition is checked later.
    3868             :          */
    3869         773 :         int want_remap = 0;
    3870             : 
    3871         773 :         ast_sockaddr_copy(us, &internip); /* starting guess for the internal address */
    3872             :         /* now ask the system what would it use to talk to 'them' */
    3873         773 :         ast_ouraddrfor(them, us);
    3874         773 :         ast_sockaddr_copy(&theirs, them);

    3876         773 :         if (ast_sockaddr_is_ipv6(&theirs) && !ast_sockaddr_is_ipv4_mapped(&theirs)) {

    3881             :                 }

    4012          43 : static int retrans_pkt(const void *data)
    4013             : {
    4014          43 :         struct sip_pkt *pkt = (struct sip_pkt *) data;
    4015             :         struct sip_pkt *prev;
    4016             :         struct sip_pkt *cur;
    4017             :         struct ast_channel *owner_chan;
    4018          43 :         int reschedule = DEFAULT_RETRANS;
    4019          43 :         int xmitres = 0;
    4020             :         /* how many ms until retrans timeout is reached */
    4021          43 :         int64_t diff = pkt->retrans_stop_time - ast_tvdiff_ms(ast_tvnow(), pkt->time_sent);
    4022             : 
    4023             :         /* Do not retransmit if time out is reached. This will be negative if the time between
    4024             :          * the first transmission and now is larger than our timeout period. This is a fail safe
    4025             :          * check in case the scheduler gets behind or the clock is changed. */
    4026          43 :         if ((diff <= 0) || (diff > pkt->retrans_stop_time)) {
    4027           2 :                 pkt->retrans_stop = 1;
    4028             :         }
    4029             : 
    4030             :         /* Lock channel PVT */
    4031          43 :         sip_pvt_lock(pkt->owner);
    4032             : 
    4033          43 :         if (!pkt->retrans_stop) {
    4034          41 :                 pkt->retrans++;
    4035          41 :                 if (!pkt->timer_t1) {        /* Re-schedule using timer_a and timer_t1 */
    4036           0 :                         if (sipdebug) {
    4037           0 :                                 ast_debug(4, "SIP TIMER: Not rescheduling id #%d:%s (Method %d) (No timer T1)\n",
    4038             :                                         pkt->retransid,
    4039             :                                         sip_methods[pkt->method].text,
    4040             :                                         pkt->method);
    4041             :                         }
    4042             :                 } else {
    4043             :                         int siptimer_a;
    4044             : 
    4045          41 :                         if (sipdebug) {

    4049             :                                         sip_methods[pkt->method].text,
    4050             :                                         pkt->method);
    4051             :                         }

    4053          14 :                                 pkt->timer_a = 2 ;

    4056             :                         }

    4095             :                  * allow any responses to the packet to be processed before the packet is destroyed on the next

    4146             :                                  * transaction just as if we received the ACK, but immediately hangup with a BYE (sip_hangup
    4147             :                                  * will send the BYE as long as the dialog is not set as "alreadygone")

    4210             : 
    4211             : /* Run by the sched thread. */
    4212        1800 : static int __stop_retrans_pkt(const void *data)
    4213             : {
    4214        1800 :         struct sip_pkt *pkt = (void *) data;
    4215             :

    4539             : /*! \brief Acknowledges receipt of a packet and stops retransmission

    4541        1389 : int __sip_ack(struct sip_pvt *p, uint32_t seqno, int resp, int sipmethod)
    4542             : {
    4543        1389 :         struct sip_pkt *cur, *prev = NULL;
    4544        1389 :         const char *msg = "Not Found";        /* used only for debugging */
    4545        1389 :         int res = FALSE;
    4546             : 
    4547             :         /* If we have an outbound proxy for this dialog, then delete it now since
    4548             :           the rest of the requests in this dialog needs to follow the routing.
    4549             :           If obforcing is set, we will keep the outbound proxy during the whole
    4550             :           dialog, regardless of what the SIP rfc says
    4551             :         */
    4552        1389 :         if (p->outboundproxy && !p->outboundproxy->force) {
    4553           5 :                 ref_proxy(p, NULL);
    4554             :         }
    4555             : 
    4556        1399 :         for (cur = p->packets; cur; prev = cur, cur = cur->next) {
    4557        1390 :                 if (cur->seqno != seqno || cur->is_resp != resp) {
    4558           7 :                         continue;
    4559             :                 }

    4561        1380 :                         res = TRUE;
    4562        1380 :                         msg = "Found";

    4565         499 :                                 p->pendinginvite = 0;
    4566             :                         }

    5097             :  * \internal

    5101           1 : static int sip_sendtext(struct ast_channel *ast, const char *text)
    5102             : {

    5104             :         int debug;
    5105             : 
    5106           1 :         if (!dialog) {
    5107           0 :                 return -1;
    5108             :         }
    5109             :         /* NOT ast_strlen_zero, because a zero-length message is specifically
    5110             :          * allowed by RFC 3428 (See section 10, Examples) */
    5111           1 :         if (!text) {
    5112           0 :                 return 0;
    5113             :         }
    5114           1 :         if(!is_method_allowed(&dialog->allowed_methods, SIP_MESSAGE)) {
    5115           0 :                 ast_debug(2, "Trying to send MESSAGE to device that does not support it.\n");
    5116           0 :                 return 0;

    5527             : /* Another little helper function for backwards compatibility: this

    5531             :  * the sippeer also had it continue look for another match, so we do
    5532             :  * the same. */
    5533           0 : static struct ast_variable *realtime_peer_get_sippeer_helper(const char **name, struct ast_variable **varregs) {

    5542           0 :                 *varregs = NULL;

    5546             : }

    5646             : /*! \brief  realtime_peer: Get peer from realtime storage
    5647             :  * Checks the "sippeers" realtime family from extconfig.conf
    5648             :  * Checks the "sipregs" realtime family from extconfig.conf if it's configured.
    5649             :  * This returns a pointer to a peer and because we use build_peer, we can rest
    5650             :  * assured that the refcount is bumped.
    5651             :  *

    6788             : 
    6789             : /*! \brief  update_call_counter: Handle call_limit for SIP devices
    6790             :  * Setting a call-limit will cause calls above the limit not to be accepted.
    6791             :  *
    6792             :  * Remember that for a type=friend, there's one limit for the user and
    6793             :  * another for the peer, not a combined call limit.
    6794             :  * This will cause unexpected behaviour in subscriptions, since a "friend"
    6795             :  * is *two* devices in Asterisk, not one.
    6796             :  *
    6797             :  * Thought: For realtime, we should probably update storage with inuse counter...
    6798             :  *
    6799             :  * \return 0 if call is ok (no call limit, below threshold)
    6800             :  *      -1 on rejection of call
    6801             :  *
    6802             :  */
    6803        1082 : static int update_call_counter(struct sip_pvt *fup, int event)
    6804             : {
    6805             :         char name[256];
    6806        1082 :         int *inuse = NULL, *call_limit = NULL, *ringing = NULL;
    6807        1082 :         int outgoing = fup->outgoing_call;
    6808        1082 :         struct sip_peer *p = NULL;
    6809             : 
    6810        1082 :         ast_debug(3, "Updating call counter for %s call\n", outgoing ? "outgoing" : "incoming");
    6811             : 
    6812             : 
    6813             :         /* Test if we need to check call limits, in order to avoid
    6814             :            realtime lookups if we do not need it */

    6817             : 
    6818          14 :         ast_copy_string(name, fup->username, sizeof(name));
    6819             : 
    6820             :         /* Check the list of devices */
    6821          14 :         if (fup->relatedpeer) {
    6822          14 :                 p = sip_ref_peer(fup->relatedpeer, "ref related peer for update_call_counter");

    6824          14 :                 call_limit = &p->call_limit;
    6825          14 :                 ringing = &p->ringing;
    6826          14 :                 ast_copy_string(name, fup->peername, sizeof(name));
    6827             :         }
    6828          14 :         if (!p) {
    6829           0 :                 ast_debug(2, "%s is not a local device, no call limit\n", name);
    6830           0 :                 return 0;
    6831             :         }
    6832             : 
    6833          14 :         switch(event) {
    6834             :         /* incoming and outgoing affects the inuse counter */
    6835           8 :         case DEC_CALL_LIMIT:

    6842           0 :                                         (*inuse)--;

    6844             :                                 }

    6847             :                         }
    6848           8 :                         ao2_unlock(p);

    6850             :                 }
    6851             :

    6944             : /*! \brief Convert SIP hangup causes to Asterisk hangup causes */
    6945        1701 : int hangup_sip2cause(int cause)
    6946             : {
    6947             :         /* Possible values taken from causes.h */
    6948             : 
    6949        1701 :         switch(cause) {
    6950          12 :                 case 401:       /* Unauthorized */
    6951          12 :                         return AST_CAUSE_CALL_REJECTED;
    6952           0 :                 case 403:       /* Not found */
    6953           0 :                         return AST_CAUSE_CALL_REJECTED;
    6954           6 :                 case 404:       /* Not found */
    6955           6 :                         return AST_CAUSE_UNALLOCATED;
    6956           0 :                 case 405:       /* Method not allowed */
    6957           0 :                         return AST_CAUSE_INTERWORKING;
    6958           0 :                 case 407:       /* Proxy authentication required */
    6959           0 :                         return AST_CAUSE_CALL_REJECTED;
    6960           0 :                 case 408:       /* No reaction */
    6961           0 :                         return AST_CAUSE_NO_USER_RESPONSE;
    6962           0 :                 case 409:       /* Conflict */
    6963           0 :                         return AST_CAUSE_NORMAL_TEMPORARY_FAILURE;

    6965           0 :                         return AST_CAUSE_NUMBER_CHANGED;

    6967           0 :                         return AST_CAUSE_INTERWORKING;

    6969           0 :                         return AST_CAUSE_INTERWORKING;

    6971           0 :                         return AST_CAUSE_INTERWORKING;

    7027           0 :                                 return AST_CAUSE_INTERWORKING;

    7030             :         }

    7032             :         return 0;

    7034             : 
    7035             : /*! \brief Convert Asterisk hangup causes to SIP codes
    7036             : \verbatim
    7037             :  Possible values from causes.h
    7038             :         AST_CAUSE_NOTDEFINED    AST_CAUSE_NORMAL        AST_CAUSE_BUSY
    7039             :         AST_CAUSE_FAILURE       AST_CAUSE_CONGESTION    AST_CAUSE_UNALLOCATED
    7040             : 
    7041             :         In addition to these, a lot of PRI codes is defined in causes.h
    7042             :         ...should we take care of them too ?
    7043             : 
    7044             :         Quote RFC 3398
    7045             : 
    7046             :    ISUP Cause value                        SIP response
    7047             :    ----------------                        ------------
    7048             :    1  unallocated number                   404 Not Found
    7049             :    2  no route to network                  404 Not found
    7050             :    3  no route to destination              404 Not found
    7051             :    16 normal call clearing                 --- (*)
    7052             :    17 user busy                            486 Busy here
    7053             :    18 no user responding                   408 Request Timeout
    7054             :    19 no answer from the user              480 Temporarily unavailable
    7055             :    20 subscriber absent                    480 Temporarily unavailable
    7056             :    21 call rejected                        403 Forbidden (+)
    7057             :    22 number changed (w/o diagnostic)      410 Gone
    7058             :    22 number changed (w/ diagnostic)       301 Moved Permanently
    7059             :    23 redirection to new destination       410 Gone
    7060             :    26 non-selected user clearing           404 Not Found (=)
    7061             :    27 destination out of order             502 Bad Gateway
    7062             :    28 address incomplete                   484 Address incomplete
    7063             :    29 facility rejected                    501 Not implemented
    7064             :    31 normal unspecified                   480 Temporarily unavailable
    7065             : \endverbatim
    7066             : */
    7067           1 : const char *hangup_cause2sip(int cause)
    7068             : {
    7069           1 :         switch (cause) {
    7070           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_UNALLOCATED:             /* 1 */
    7071             :                 case AST_CAUSE_NO_ROUTE_DESTINATION:    /* 3 IAX2: Can't find extension in context */
    7072             :                 case AST_CAUSE_NO_ROUTE_TRANSIT_NET:    /* 2 */
    7073           0 :                         return "404 Not Found";
    7074           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_CONGESTION:              /* 34 */
    7075             :                 case AST_CAUSE_SWITCH_CONGESTION:       /* 42 */
    7076           0 :                         return "503 Service Unavailable";
    7077           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_NO_USER_RESPONSE:        /* 18 */
    7078           0 :                         return "408 Request Timeout";
    7079           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_NO_ANSWER:               /* 19 */
    7080             :                 case AST_CAUSE_UNREGISTERED:        /* 20 */
    7081           0 :                         return "480 Temporarily unavailable";
    7082           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_CALL_REJECTED:           /* 21 */
    7083           0 :                         return "403 Forbidden";
    7084           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_NUMBER_CHANGED:          /* 22 */
    7085           0 :                         return "410 Gone";
    7086           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_NORMAL_UNSPECIFIED:      /* 31 */
    7087           0 :                         return "480 Temporarily unavailable";
    7088           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_INVALID_NUMBER_FORMAT:
    7089           0 :                         return "484 Address incomplete";
    7090           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_USER_BUSY:
    7091           0 :                         return "486 Busy here";
    7092           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_FAILURE:
    7093           0 :                         return "500 Server internal failure";
    7094           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_FACILITY_REJECTED:       /* 29 */
    7095           0 :                         return "501 Not Implemented";
    7096           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_CHAN_NOT_IMPLEMENTED:
    7097           0 :                         return "503 Service Unavailable";
    7098             :                 /* Used in chan_iax2 */
    7099           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_DESTINATION_OUT_OF_ORDER:
    7100           0 :                         return "502 Bad Gateway";
    7101           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_BEARERCAPABILITY_NOTAVAIL:       /* Can't find codec to connect to host */
    7102           0 :                         return "488 Not Acceptable Here";
    7103           0 :                 case AST_CAUSE_INTERWORKING:    /* Unspecified Interworking issues */
    7104           0 :                         return "500 Network error";
    7105             : 
    7106           1 :                 case AST_CAUSE_NOTDEFINED:
    7107             :                 default:
    7108           1 :                         ast_debug(1, "AST hangup cause %d (no match found in SIP)\n", cause);
    7109           1 :                         return NULL;
    7110             :         }
    7111             : 
    7112             :         /* Never reached */
    7113             :         return 0;
    7114             : }
    7115             : 
    7116             : /* Run by the sched thread. */
    7117           1 : static int reinvite_timeout(const void *data)
    7118             : {
    7119           1 :         struct sip_pvt *dialog = (struct sip_pvt *) data;
    7120             :         struct ast_channel *owner;
    7121             : 
    7122           1 :         owner = sip_pvt_lock_full(dialog);
    7123           1 :         dialog->reinviteid = -1;
    7124           1 :         check_pendings(dialog);
    7125           1 :         if (owner) {
    7126           0 :                 ast_channel_unlock(owner);
    7127           0 :                 ast_channel_unref(owner);
    7128             :         }
    7129           1 :         sip_pvt_unlock(dialog);
    7130           1 :         dialog_unref(dialog, "reinviteid complete");
    7131           1 :         return 0;
    7132             : }
    7133             : 
    7134             : /* Run by the sched thread. */
    7135         173 : static int __stop_reinviteid(const void *data)
    7136             : {
    7137         173 :         struct sip_pvt *pvt = (void *) data;
    7138             : 
    7139         173 :         AST_SCHED_DEL_UNREF(sched, pvt->reinviteid,
    7140             :                 dialog_unref(pvt, "Stop scheduled reinviteid"));
    7141         173 :         dialog_unref(pvt, "Stop reinviteid action");
    7142         173 :         return 0;
    7143             : }
    7144             : 
    7145         173 : static void stop_reinviteid(struct sip_pvt *pvt)
    7146             : {
    7147         173 :         dialog_ref(pvt, "Stop reinviteid action");
    7148         173 :         if (ast_sched_add(sched, 0, __stop_reinviteid, pvt) < 0) {
    7149             :                 /* Uh Oh.  Expect bad behavior. */
    7150           0 :                 dialog_unref(pvt, "Failed to schedule stop reinviteid action");
    7151             :         }
    7152         173 : }
    7153             : 
    7154             : /*! \brief  sip_hangup: Hangup SIP call
    7155             :  * Part of PBX interface, called from ast_hangup */
    7156         641 : static int sip_hangup(struct ast_channel *ast)
    7157             : {
    7158         641 :         struct sip_pvt *p = ast_channel_tech_pvt(ast);
    7159         641 :         int needcancel = FALSE;
    7160         641 :         int needdestroy = 0;
    7161         641 :         struct ast_channel *oldowner = ast;
    7162             : 
    7163         641 :         if (!p) {
    7164           0 :                 ast_debug(1, "Asked to hangup channel that was not connected\n");
    7165           0 :                 return 0;
    7166             :         }
    7167         641 :         if (ast_channel_hangupcause(ast) == AST_CAUSE_ANSWERED_ELSEWHERE) {
    7168           1 :                 ast_debug(1, "This call was answered elsewhere\n");
    7169           1 :                 append_history(p, "Cancel", "Call answered elsewhere");
    7170           1 :                 p->answered_elsewhere = TRUE;
    7171             :         }
    7172             : 
    7173             :         /* Store hangupcause locally in PVT so we still have it before disconnect */
    7174         641 :         if (p->owner)
    7175         641 :                 p->hangupcause = ast_channel_hangupcause(p->owner);
    7176             : 
    7177         641 :         if (ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_DEFER_BYE_ON_TRANSFER)) {
    7178           5 :                 if (ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_INC_COUNT) || ast_test_flag(&p->flags[1], SIP_PAGE2_CALL_ONHOLD)) {
    7179           2 :                         if (sipdebug)
    7180           2 :                                 ast_debug(1, "update_call_counter(%s) - decrement call limit counter on hangup\n", p->username);
    7181           2 :                         update_call_counter(p, DEC_CALL_LIMIT);
    7182             :                 }
    7183           5 :                 ast_debug(4, "SIP Transfer: Not hanging up right now... Rescheduling hangup for %s.\n", p->callid);
    7184           5 :                 sip_scheddestroy(p, DEFAULT_TRANS_TIMEOUT);
    7185           5 :                 ast_clear_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_DEFER_BYE_ON_TRANSFER); /* Really hang up next time */
    7186           5 :                 if (p->owner) {
    7187           5 :                         sip_pvt_lock(p);
    7188           5 :                         oldowner = p->owner;
    7189           5 :                         sip_set_owner(p, NULL); /* Owner will be gone after we return, so take it away */
    7190           5 :                         sip_pvt_unlock(p);
    7191           5 :                         ast_channel_tech_pvt_set(oldowner, dialog_unref(ast_channel_tech_pvt(oldowner), "unref oldowner->tech_pvt"));
    7192             :                 }
    7193           5 :                 ast_module_unref(ast_module_info->self);
    7194           5 :                 return 0;
    7195             :         }
    7196             : 
    7197         636 :         ast_debug(1, "Hangup call %s, SIP callid %s\n", ast_channel_name(ast), p->callid);
    7198             : 
    7199         636 :         sip_pvt_lock(p);
    7200         636 :         if (ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_INC_COUNT) || ast_test_flag(&p->flags[1], SIP_PAGE2_CALL_ONHOLD)) {
    7201           2 :                 if (sipdebug)
    7202           2 :                         ast_debug(1, "update_call_counter(%s) - decrement call limit counter on hangup\n", p->username);
    7203           2 :                 update_call_counter(p, DEC_CALL_LIMIT);
    7204             :         }
    7205             : 
    7206             :         /* Determine how to disconnect */
    7207         636 :         if (p->owner != ast) {
    7208           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Huh?  We aren't the owner? Can't hangup call.\n");
    7209           0 :                 sip_pvt_unlock(p);
    7210           0 :                 return 0;
    7211             :         }
    7212             :         /* If the call is not UP, we need to send CANCEL instead of BYE */
    7213             :         /* In case of re-invites, the call might be UP even though we have an incomplete invite transaction */
    7214         636 :         if (p->invitestate < INV_COMPLETED && ast_channel_state(p->owner) != AST_STATE_UP) {
    7215           7 :                 needcancel = TRUE;
    7216           7 :                 ast_debug(4, "Hanging up channel in state %s (not UP)\n", ast_state2str(ast_channel_state(ast)));
    7217             :         }
    7218             : 
    7219         636 :         stop_media_flows(p); /* Immediately stop RTP, VRTP and UDPTL as applicable */
    7220             : 
    7221         636 :         append_history(p, needcancel ? "Cancel" : "Hangup", "Cause %s", ast_cause2str(p->hangupcause));
    7222             : 
    7223             :         /* Disconnect */
    7224         636 :         disable_dsp_detect(p);
    7225             : 
    7226         636 :         sip_set_owner(p, NULL);
    7227         636 :         ast_channel_tech_pvt_set(ast, NULL);
    7228             : 
    7229         636 :         ast_module_unref(ast_module_info->self);
    7230             :         /* Do not destroy this pvt until we have timeout or
    7231             :            get an answer to the BYE or INVITE/CANCEL
    7232             :            If we get no answer during retransmit period, drop the call anyway.
    7233             :            (Sorry, mother-in-law, you can't deny a hangup by sending
    7234             :            603 declined to BYE...)
    7235             :         */
    7236         636 :         if (p->alreadygone)
    7237         352 :                 needdestroy = 1;        /* Set destroy flag at end of this function */
    7238         284 :         else if (p->invitestate != INV_CALLING)
    7239         283 :                 sip_scheddestroy(p, DEFAULT_TRANS_TIMEOUT);
    7240             : 
    7241             :         /* Start the process if it's not already started */
    7242         636 :         if (!p->alreadygone && p->initreq.data && ast_str_strlen(p->initreq.data)) {
    7243         284 :                 if (needcancel) {       /* Outgoing call, not up */
    7244           7 :                         if (ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_OUTGOING)) {
    7245             :                                 /* if we can't send right now, mark it pending */
    7246           6 :                                 if (p->invitestate == INV_CALLING) {

    7627             : 
    7628         448 : static int sip_senddigit_begin(struct ast_channel *ast, char digit)
    7629             : {
    7630         448 :         struct sip_pvt *p = ast_channel_tech_pvt(ast);
    7631         448 :         int res = 0;
    7632             : 
    7633         448 :         if (!p) {
    7634           0 :                 ast_debug(1, "Asked to begin DTMF digit on channel %s with no pvt; ignoring\n",
    7635             :                                 ast_channel_name(ast));
    7636           0 :                 return res;
    7637             :         }
    7638             : 
    7639         448 :         sip_pvt_lock(p);
    7640         448 :         switch (ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_DTMF)) {
    7641           2 :         case SIP_DTMF_INBAND:
    7642           2 :                 res = -1; /* Tell Asterisk to generate inband indications */

    7902             : /*! \brief Play indication to user
    7903             :  * With SIP a lot of indications is sent as messages, letting the device play
    7904             :    the indication - busy signal, congestion etc
    7905             :    \return -1 to force ast_indicate to send indication in audio, 0 if SIP can handle the indication by sending a message
    7906             : */
    7907        2301 : static int sip_indicate(struct ast_channel *ast, int condition, const void *data, size_t datalen)
    7908             : {
    7909        2301 :         struct sip_pvt *p = ast_channel_tech_pvt(ast);
    7910        2301 :         int res = 0;
    7911             : 
    7912        2301 :         if (!p) {
    7913           0 :                 ast_debug(1, "Asked to indicate condition on channel %s with no pvt; ignoring\n",
    7914             :                                 ast_channel_name(ast));
    7915           0 :                 return res;
    7916             :         }
    7917             :

    7922          36 :                         p->invitestate = INV_EARLY_MEDIA;

    7924           0 :                             (ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_PROG_INBAND) == SIP_PROG_INBAND_NEVER)) {

    8518       74171 : static const char *__get_header(const struct sip_request *req, const char *name, int *start)
    8519             : {
    8520             :         /*
    8521             :          * Technically you can place arbitrary whitespace both before and after the ':' in
    8522             :          * a header, although RFC3261 clearly says you shouldn't before, and place just
    8523             :          * one afterwards.  If you shouldn't do it, what absolute idiot decided it was
    8524             :          * a good idea to say you can do it, and if you can do it, why in the hell would.
    8525             :          * you say you shouldn't.
    8526             :          */
    8527       74171 :         const char *sname = find_alias(name, NULL);
    8528       74171 :         int x, len = strlen(name), slen = (sname ? 1 : 0);

    8530      498266 :                 const char *header = REQ_OFFSET_TO_STR(req, header[x]);
    8531      498266 :                 int smatch = 0, match = !strncasecmp(header, name, len);
    8532      498266 :                 if (slen) {
    8533      251770 :                         smatch = !strncasecmp(header, sname, slen);
    8534             :                 }
    8535      498266 :                 if (match || smatch) {
    8536             :                         /* skip name */
    8537       63902 :                         const char *r = header + (match ? len : slen );
    8538             :                         /* HCOLON has optional SP/HTAB; skip past those */
    8539       63902 :                         while (*r == ' ' || *r == '\t') {
    8540           0 :                                 ++r;
    8541             :                         }
    8542       63902 :                         if (*r == ':') {
    8543       56603 :                                 *start = x+1;

    8545             :                         }
    8546             :                 }
    8547             :         }
    8548             : 
    8549             :         /* Don't return NULL, so sip_get_header is always a valid pointer */
    8550       17568 :         return "";

    8793             : /*! \brief Unlink the given object from the container and return TRUE if it was in the container. */
    8794             : #define CONTAINER_UNLINK(container, obj, tag)                                                           \
    8795             :         ({                                                                                                                                              \
    8796             :                 int found = 0;                                                                                                          \
    8797             :                 typeof((obj)) __removed_obj;                                                                            \
    8798             :                 __removed_obj = ao2_t_callback((container),                                                     \
    8799             :                         OBJ_UNLINK | OBJ_POINTER, ao2_match_by_addr, (obj), (tag));             \
    8800             :                 if (__removed_obj) {                                                                                            \
    8801             :                         ao2_ref(__removed_obj, -1);                                                                             \
    8802             :                         found = 1;                                                                                                              \
    8803             :                 }                                                                                                                                       \
    8804             :                 found;                                                                                                                          \
    8805             :         })

    9058             : /*!
    9059             :  * \brief Process the Via header according to RFC 3261 section 18.2.2.
    9060             :  * \param p a sip_pvt structure that will be modified according to the received
    9061             :  * header
    9062             :  * \param req a sip request with a Via header to process
    9063             :  *
    9064             :  * This function will update the destination of the response according to the
    9065             :  * Via header in the request and RFC 3261 section 18.2.2. We do not have a
    9066             :  * transport layer so we ignore certain values like the 'received' param (we
    9067             :  * set the destination address to the address the request came from in the
    9068             :  * respprep() function).
    9069             :  *
    9070             :  * \retval -1 error
    9071             :  * \retval 0 success
    9072             :  */
    9073        1573 : static int process_via(struct sip_pvt *p, const struct sip_request *req)
    9074             : {
    9075        1573 :         struct sip_via *via = parse_via(sip_get_header(req, "Via"));
    9076             : 
    9077        1573 :         if (!via) {
    9078           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "error processing via header\n");
    9079           0 :                 return -1;
    9080             :         }
    9081             : 
    9082        1573 :         if (via->maddr) {
    9083           0 :                 if (ast_sockaddr_resolve_first_transport(&p->sa, via->maddr, PARSE_PORT_FORBID, p->socket.type)) {
    9084           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Can't find address for maddr '%s'\n", via->maddr);
    9085           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "error processing via header\n");
    9086           0 :                         free_via(via);
    9087           0 :                         return -1;
    9088             :                 }
    9089             : 
    9090           0 :                 if (ast_sockaddr_is_ipv4_multicast(&p->sa)) {
    9091           0 :                         setsockopt(sipsock, IPPROTO_IP, IP_MULTICAST_TTL, &via->ttl, sizeof(via->ttl));
    9092             :                 }
    9093             :         }
    9094             : 
    9095        1573 :         ast_sockaddr_set_port(&p->sa, via->port ? via->port : STANDARD_SIP_PORT);
    9096             : 
    9097        1573 :         free_via(via);
    9098        1573 :         return 0;
    9099             : }
    9100             : 
    9101             : /* \brief arguments used for Request/Response to matching */
    9102             : struct match_req_args {
    9103             :         int method;
    9104             :         const char *callid;
    9105             :         const char *totag;
    9106             :         const char *fromtag;
    9107             :         uint32_t seqno;
    9108             : 
    9109             :         /* Set if this method is a Response */
    9110             :         int respid;
    9111             : 
    9112             :         /* Set if the method is a Request */
    9113             :         const char *ruri;
    9114             :         const char *viabranch;
    9115             :         const char *viasentby;
    9116             : 
    9117             :         /* Set this if the Authentication header is present in the Request. */
    9118             :         int authentication_present;
    9119             : };
    9120             : 
    9121             : enum match_req_res {
    9122             :         SIP_REQ_MATCH,
    9123             :         SIP_REQ_NOT_MATCH,
    9124             :         SIP_REQ_LOOP_DETECTED, /* multiple incoming requests with same call-id but different branch parameters have been detected */
    9125             :         SIP_REQ_FORKED, /* An outgoing request has been forked as result of receiving two differing 200ok responses. */
    9126             : };
    9127             : 
    9128             : /*
    9129             :  * \brief Match a incoming Request/Response to a dialog
    9130             :  *
    9131             :  * \retval enum match_req_res indicating if the dialog matches the arg
    9132             :  */
    9133        2412 : static enum match_req_res match_req_to_dialog(struct sip_pvt *sip_pvt_ptr, struct match_req_args *arg)
    9134             : {
    9135        2412 :         const char *init_ruri = NULL;
    9136        2412 :         if (sip_pvt_ptr->initreq.headers) {
    9137        2410 :                 init_ruri = REQ_OFFSET_TO_STR(&sip_pvt_ptr->initreq, rlpart2);
    9138             :         }
    9139             : 
    9140             :         /*
    9141             :          * Match Tags and call-id to Dialog
    9142             :          */
    9143        2412 :         if (!ast_strlen_zero(arg->callid) && strcmp(sip_pvt_ptr->callid, arg->callid)) {
    9144             :                 /* call-id does not match. */
    9145           0 :                 return SIP_REQ_NOT_MATCH;
    9146             :         }
    9147        2412 :         if (arg->method == SIP_RESPONSE) {
    9148             :                 /* Verify fromtag of response matches the tag we gave them. */
    9149        1240 :                 if (strcmp(arg->fromtag, sip_pvt_ptr->tag)) {
    9150             :                         /* fromtag from response does not match our tag */
    9151          14 :                         return SIP_REQ_NOT_MATCH;
    9152             :                 }
    9153             : 
    9154             :                 /* Verify totag if we have one stored for this dialog, but never be strict about this for
    9155             :                  * a response until the dialog is established */
    9156        1226 :                 if (!ast_strlen_zero(sip_pvt_ptr->theirtag) && ast_test_flag(&sip_pvt_ptr->flags[1], SIP_PAGE2_DIALOG_ESTABLISHED)) {
    9157         582 :                         if (ast_strlen_zero(arg->totag)) {
    9158             :                                 /* missing totag when they already gave us one earlier */
    9159           0 :                                 return SIP_REQ_NOT_MATCH;
    9160             :                         }
    9161             :                         /* compare the totag of response with the tag we have stored for them */
    9162         582 :                         if (strcmp(arg->totag, sip_pvt_ptr->theirtag)) {
    9163             :                                 /* totag did not match what we had stored for them. */
    9164           0 :                                 char invite_branch[32] = { 0, };
    9165           0 :                                 if (sip_pvt_ptr->invite_branch) {
    9166           0 :                                         snprintf(invite_branch, sizeof(invite_branch), "z9hG4bK%08x", (unsigned)sip_pvt_ptr->invite_branch);
    9167             :                                 }
    9168             :                                 /* Forked Request Detection
    9169             :                                  *
    9170             :                                  * If this is a 200ok response and the totags do not match, this
    9171             :                                  * might be a forked response to an outgoing Request. Detection of
    9172             :                                  * a forked response must meet the criteria below.
    9173             :                                  *
    9174             :                                  * 1. must be a 2xx Response
    9175             :                                  * 2. call-d equal to call-id of Request. this is done earlier
    9176             :                                  * 3. from-tag equal to from-tag of Request. this is done earlier
    9177             :                                  * 4. branch parameter equal to branch of inital Request
    9178             :                                  * 5. to-tag _NOT_ equal to previous 2xx response that already established the dialog.
    9179             :                                  */
    9180           0 :                                 if ((arg->respid == 200) &&
    9181           0 :                                         !ast_strlen_zero(invite_branch) &&
    9182           0 :                                         !ast_strlen_zero(arg->viabranch) &&
    9183           0 :                                         !strcmp(invite_branch, arg->viabranch)) {
    9184           0 :                                         return SIP_REQ_FORKED;
    9185             :                                 }
    9186             : 
    9187             :                                 /* The totag did not match the one we had stored, and this is not a Forked Request. */
    9188           0 :                                 return SIP_REQ_NOT_MATCH;
    9189             :                         }
    9190             :                 }
    9191             :         } else {
    9192             :                 /* Verify the fromtag of Request matches the tag they provided earlier.
    9193             :                  * If this is a Request with authentication credentials, forget their old
    9194             :                  * tag as it is not valid after the 401 or 407 response. */
    9195        1172 :                 if (!arg->authentication_present && strcmp(arg->fromtag, sip_pvt_ptr->theirtag)) {
    9196             :                         /* their tag does not match the one was have stored for them */
    9197          67 :                         return SIP_REQ_NOT_MATCH;
    9198             :                 }
    9199             :                 /* Verify if totag is present in Request, that it matches what we gave them as our tag earlier */
    9200        1105 :                 if (!ast_strlen_zero(arg->totag) && (strcmp(arg->totag, sip_pvt_ptr->tag))) {
    9201             :                         /* totag from Request does not match our tag */
    9202           0 :                         return SIP_REQ_NOT_MATCH;
    9203             :                 }
    9204             :         }
    9205             : 
    9206             :         /*
    9207             :          * Compare incoming request against initial transaction.
    9208             :          *
    9209             :          * This is a best effort attempt at distinguishing forked requests from
    9210             :          * our initial transaction.  If all the elements are NOT in place to evaluate
    9211             :          * this, this block is ignored and the dialog match is made regardless.
    9212             :          * Once the totag is established after the dialog is confirmed, this is not necessary.
    9213             :          *
    9214             :          * CRITERIA required for initial transaction matching.
    9215             :          *
    9216             :          * 1. Is a Request
    9217             :          * 2. Callid and theirtag match (this is done in the dialog matching block)
    9218             :          * 3. totag is NOT present
    9219             :          * 4. CSeq matchs our initial transaction's cseq number
    9220             :          * 5. pvt has init via branch parameter stored
    9221             :          */
    9222        3436 :         if ((arg->method != SIP_RESPONSE) &&                 /* must be a Request */
    9223        1105 :                 ast_strlen_zero(arg->totag) &&                   /* must not have a totag */
    9224          54 :                 (sip_pvt_ptr->init_icseq == arg->seqno) &&       /* the cseq must be the same as this dialogs initial cseq */
    9225           6 :                 !ast_strlen_zero(sip_pvt_ptr->initviabranch) &&  /* The dialog must have started with a RFC3261 compliant branch tag */
    9226             :                 init_ruri) {                                     /* the dialog must have an initial request uri associated with it */
    9227             :                 /* This Request matches all the criteria required for Loop/Merge detection.
    9228             :                  * Now we must go down the path of comparing VIA's and RURIs. */
    9229           3 :                 if (ast_strlen_zero(arg->viabranch) ||
    9230           6 :                         strcmp(arg->viabranch, sip_pvt_ptr->initviabranch) ||
    9231           3 :                         ast_strlen_zero(arg->viasentby) ||
    9232           3 :                         strcmp(arg->viasentby, sip_pvt_ptr->initviasentby)) {
    9233             :                         /* At this point, this request does not match this Dialog.*/
    9234             : 
    9235             :                         /* if methods are different this is just a mismatch */
    9236           0 :                         if ((sip_pvt_ptr->method != arg->method)) {
    9237           0 :                                 return SIP_REQ_NOT_MATCH;
    9238             :                         }
    9239             : 
    9240             :                         /* If RUIs are different, this is a forked request to a separate URI.
    9241             :                          * Returning a mismatch allows this Request to be processed separately. */
    9242           0 :                         if (sip_uri_cmp(init_ruri, arg->ruri)) {
    9243             :                                 /* not a match, request uris are different */
    9244           0 :                                 return SIP_REQ_NOT_MATCH;
    9245             :                         }
    9246             : 
    9247             :                         /* Loop/Merge Detected
    9248             :                          *
    9249             :                          * ---Current Matches to Initial Request---
    9250             :                          * request uri
    9251             :                          * Call-id
    9252             :                          * their-tag
    9253             :                          * no totag present
    9254             :                          * method
    9255             :                          * cseq
    9256             :                          *
    9257             :                          * --- Does not Match Initial Request ---
    9258             :                          * Top Via
    9259             :                          *
    9260             :                          * Without the same Via, this can not match our initial transaction for this dialog,
    9261             :                          * but given that this Request matches everything else associated with that initial
    9262             :                          * Request this is most certainly a Forked request in which we have already received
    9263             :                          * part of the fork.
    9264             :                          */
    9265           0 :                         return SIP_REQ_LOOP_DETECTED;
    9266             :                 }
    9267             :         } /* end of Request Via check */
    9268             : 
    9269             :         /* Match Authentication Request.
    9270             :          *
    9271             :          * A Request with an Authentication header must come back with the
    9272             :          * same Request URI.  Otherwise it is not a match.
    9273             :          */
    9274        3436 :         if ((arg->method != SIP_RESPONSE) &&      /* Must be a Request type to even begin checking this */
    9275        1105 :                 ast_strlen_zero(arg->totag) &&        /* no totag is present to match */
    9276          72 :                 arg->authentication_present &&        /* Authentication header is present in Request */
    9277          21 :                 sip_uri_cmp(init_ruri, arg->ruri)) {  /* Compare the Request URI of both the last Request and this new one */
    9278             : 
    9279             :                 /* Authentication was provided, but the Request URI did not match the last one on this dialog. */
    9280           0 :                 return SIP_REQ_NOT_MATCH;
    9281             :         }
    9282             : 
    9283        2331 :         return SIP_REQ_MATCH;
    9284             : }
    9285             : 
    9286             : /*! \brief This function creates a dialog to handle a forked request.  This dialog
    9287             :  * exists only to properly terminiate the forked request immediately.
    9288             :  */
    9289           0 : static void forked_invite_init(struct sip_request *req, const char *new_theirtag, struct sip_pvt *original, struct ast_sockaddr *addr)
    9290             : {
    9291             :         struct sip_pvt *p;
    9292             :         const char *callid;
    9293             :         ast_callid logger_callid;
    9294             : 
    9295           0 :         sip_pvt_lock(original);
    9296           0 :         callid = ast_strdupa(original->callid);
    9297           0 :         logger_callid = original->logger_callid;
    9298           0 :         sip_pvt_unlock(original);
    9299             : 
    9300           0 :         p = sip_alloc(callid, addr, 1, SIP_INVITE, req, logger_callid);
    9301           0 :         if (!p)  {
    9302           0 :                 return; /* alloc error */
    9303             :         }
    9304             : 
    9305             :         /* Lock p and original private structures. */
    9306           0 :         sip_pvt_lock(p);
    9307           0 :         while (sip_pvt_trylock(original)) {
    9308             :                 /* Can't use DEADLOCK_AVOIDANCE since p is an ao2 object */
    9309           0 :                 sip_pvt_unlock(p);
    9310           0 :                 sched_yield();
    9311           0 :                 sip_pvt_lock(p);
    9312             :         }
    9313             : 
    9314           0 :         p->invitestate = INV_TERMINATED;
    9315           0 :         p->ocseq = original->ocseq;
    9316           0 :         p->branch = original->branch;
    9317             : 
    9318           0 :         memcpy(&p->flags, &original->flags, sizeof(p->flags));
    9319           0 :         copy_request(&p->initreq, &original->initreq);

    9322           0 :         ast_string_field_set(p, uri, original->uri);

    9324           0 :         ast_string_field_set(p, fullcontact, original->fullcontact);
    9325             : 
    9326           0 :         sip_pvt_unlock(original);
    9327             : 
    9328           0 :         parse_ok_contact(p, req);
    9329           0 :         build_route(p, req, 1, 0);
    9330             : 
    9331           0 :         transmit_request(p, SIP_ACK, p->ocseq, XMIT_UNRELIABLE, TRUE);
    9332           0 :         transmit_request(p, SIP_BYE, 0, XMIT_RELIABLE, TRUE);
    9333             : 
    9334           0 :         pvt_set_needdestroy(p, "forked request"); /* this dialog will terminate once the BYE is responed to or times out. */

    9338             : 
    9339             : /*! \internal
    9340             :  *
    9341             :  * \brief Locks both pvt and pvt owner if owner is present.
    9342             :  *
    9343             :  * \note This function gives a ref to pvt->owner if it is present and locked.
    9344             :  *       This reference must be decremented after pvt->owner is unlocked.
    9345             :  *
    9346             :  * \note This function will never give you up,
    9347             :  * \note This function will never let you down.
    9348             :  * \note This function will run around and desert you.
    9349             :  *
    9350             :  * \pre pvt is not locked
    9351             :  * \post pvt is locked
    9352             :  * \post pvt->owner is locked and its reference count is increased (if pvt->owner is not NULL)
    9353             :  *
    9354             :  * \return a pointer to the locked and reffed pvt->owner channel if it exists.
    9355             :  */
    9356        5923 : static struct ast_channel *sip_pvt_lock_full(struct sip_pvt *pvt)
    9357             : {
    9358             :         struct ast_channel *chan;
    9359             : 
    9360             :         /* Locking is simple when it is done right.  If you see a deadlock resulting
    9361             :          * in this function, it is not this function's fault, Your problem exists elsewhere.
    9362             :          * This function is perfect... seriously. */
    9363             :         for (;;) {
    9364             :                 /* First, get the channel and grab a reference to it */
    9365        5923 :                 sip_pvt_lock(pvt);
    9366        5923 :                 chan = pvt->owner;
    9367        5923 :                 if (chan) {
    9368             :                         /* The channel can not go away while we hold the pvt lock.
    9369             :                          * Give the channel a ref so it will not go away after we let
    9370             :                          * the pvt lock go. */
    9371        3996 :                         ast_channel_ref(chan);
    9372             :                 } else {
    9373             :                         /* no channel, return pvt locked */
    9374        1927 :                         return NULL;
    9375             :                 }
    9376             : 
    9377             :                 /* We had to hold the pvt lock while getting a ref to the owner channel
    9378             :                  * but now we have to let this lock go in order to preserve proper
    9379             :                  * locking order when grabbing the channel lock */
    9380        3996 :                 sip_pvt_unlock(pvt);
    9381             : 
    9382             :                 /* Look, no deadlock avoidance, hooray! */
    9383        3996 :                 ast_channel_lock(chan);
    9384        3996 :                 sip_pvt_lock(pvt);
    9385             : 
    9386        3996 :                 if (pvt->owner == chan) {
    9387             :                         /* done */
    9388        3982 :                         break;
    9389             :                 }
    9390             : 
    9391             :                 /* If the owner changed while everything was unlocked, no problem,
    9392             :                  * just start over and everthing will work.  This is rare, do not be
    9393             :                  * confused by this loop and think this it is an expensive operation.
    9394             :                  * The majority of the calls to this function will never involve multiple
    9395             :                  * executions of this loop. */
    9396          14 :                 ast_channel_unlock(chan);
    9397          14 :                 ast_channel_unref(chan);
    9398          14 :                 sip_pvt_unlock(pvt);
    9399             :         }
    9400             : 
    9401             :         /* If owner exists, it is locked and reffed */
    9402        3982 :         return pvt->owner;
    9403             : }

    9751       10280 : static void mark_method_allowed(unsigned int *allowed_methods, enum sipmethod method)
    9752             : {
    9753       10280 :         (*allowed_methods) |= (1 << method);
    9754       10280 : }
    9755             : 
    9756           0 : static void mark_method_unallowed(unsigned int *allowed_methods, enum sipmethod method)
    9757             : {
    9758           0 :         (*allowed_methods) &= ~(1 << method);
    9759           0 : }
    9760             : 
    9761             : /*! \brief Check if method is allowed for a device or a dialog */
    9762          10 : static int is_method_allowed(unsigned int *allowed_methods, enum sipmethod method)
    9763             : {
    9764          10 :         return ((*allowed_methods) >> method) & 1;
    9765             : }
    9766             : 
    9767         934 : static void mark_parsed_methods(unsigned int *methods, char *methods_str)
    9768             : {
    9769             :         char *method;
    9770       11214 :         for (method = strsep(&methods_str, ","); !ast_strlen_zero(method); method = strsep(&methods_str, ",")) {
    9771       10280 :                 int id = find_sip_method(ast_skip_blanks(method));
    9772       10280 :                 if (id == SIP_UNKNOWN) {
    9773           0 :                         continue;

    9778             : /*!
    9779             :  * \brief parse the Allow header to see what methods the endpoint we
    9780             :  * are communicating with allows.
    9781             :  *
    9782             :  * We parse the allow header on incoming Registrations and save the
    9783             :  * result to the SIP peer that is registering. When the registration
    9784             :  * expires, we clear what we know about the peer's allowed methods.
    9785             :  * When the peer re-registers, we once again parse to see if the
    9786             :  * list of allowed methods has changed.
    9787             :  *
    9788             :  * For peers that do not register, we parse the first message we receive
    9789             :  * during a call to see what is allowed, and save the information
    9790             :  * for the duration of the call.
    9791             :  * \param req The SIP request we are parsing
    9792             :  * \retval The methods allowed
    9793             :  */
    9794        1381 : static unsigned int parse_allowed_methods(struct sip_request *req)
    9795             : {
    9796        1381 :         char *allow = ast_strdupa(sip_get_header(req, "Allow"));
    9797        1381 :         unsigned int allowed_methods = SIP_UNKNOWN;
    9798             : 
    9799        1381 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(allow)) {
    9800             :                 /* I have witnessed that REGISTER requests from Polycom phones do not
    9801             :                  * place the phone's allowed methods in an Allow header. Instead, they place the
    9802             :                  * allowed methods in a methods= parameter in the Contact header.
    9803             :                  */
    9804         447 :                 char *contact = ast_strdupa(sip_get_header(req, "Contact"));
    9805         447 :                 char *methods = strstr(contact, ";methods=");
    9806             : 
    9807         447 :                 if (ast_strlen_zero(methods)) {
    9808             :                         /* RFC 3261 states:
    9809             :                          *
    9810             :                          * "The absence of an Allow header field MUST NOT be
    9811             :                          * interpreted to mean that the UA sending the message supports no
    9812             :                          * methods.   Rather, it implies that the UA is not providing any
    9813             :                          * information on what methods it supports."
    9814             :                          *
    9815             :                          * For simplicity, we'll assume that the peer allows all known
    9816             :                          * SIP methods if they have no Allow header. We can then clear out the necessary
    9817             :                          * bits if the peer lets us know that we have sent an unsupported method.
    9818             :                          */
    9819         447 :                         return UINT_MAX;
    9820             :                 }
    9821           0 :                 allow = ast_strip_quoted(methods + 9, "\"", "\"");
    9822             :         }
    9823         934 :         mark_parsed_methods(&allowed_methods, allow);
    9824         934 :         return allowed_methods;
    9825             : }
    9826             : 
    9827             : /*! A wrapper for parse_allowed_methods geared toward sip_pvts
    9828             :  *

    9835             :  */

    9837             : {
    9838        1381 :         pvt->allowed_methods = parse_allowed_methods(req);
    9839             : 
    9840        1381 :         if (ast_test_flag(&pvt->flags[1], SIP_PAGE2_RPID_UPDATE)) {
    9841           0 :                 mark_method_allowed(&pvt->allowed_methods, SIP_UPDATE);
    9842             :         }
    9843        1381 :         pvt->allowed_methods &= ~(pvt->disallowed_methods);
    9844             : 
    9845        1381 :         return pvt->allowed_methods;
    9846             : }

    9851             : {
    9852        2857 :         char *msgbuf = ast_str_buffer(data);

    9860       47602 :                         h++;
    9861       47602 :                         continue;
    9862             :                 }
