    9896             : /*! \brief Parse a SIP message
    9897             :         \note this function is used both on incoming and outgoing packets
    9898             : */
    9899        3330 : static int parse_request(struct sip_request *req)
    9900             : {
    9901        3330 :         char *c = ast_str_buffer(req->data);
    9902        3330 :         ptrdiff_t *dst = req->header;
    9903        3330 :         int i = 0;
    9904        3330 :         unsigned int lim = SIP_MAX_HEADERS - 1;
    9905        3330 :         unsigned int skipping_headers = 0;
    9906        3330 :         ptrdiff_t current_header_offset = 0;
    9907        3330 :         char *previous_header = "";
    9908             : 
    9909        3330 :         req->header[0] = 0;
    9910        3330 :         req->headers = -1;   /* mark that we are working on the header */
    9911     1830908 :         for (; *c; c++) {
    9912     1827578 :                 if (*c == '\r') {               /* remove \r */
    9913        7041 :                         *c = '\0';
    9914     1820537 :                 } else if (*c == '\n') {        /* end of this line */
    9915       51265 :                         *c = '\0';
    9916       51265 :                         current_header_offset = (c + 1) - ast_str_buffer(req->data);
    9917       51265 :                         previous_header = ast_str_buffer(req->data) + dst[i];
    9918       51265 :                         if (skipping_headers) {
    9919             :                                 /* check to see if this line is blank; if so, turn off
    9920             :                                    the skipping flag, so the next line will be processed
    9921             :                                    as a body line */
    9922           0 :                                 if (ast_strlen_zero(previous_header)) {
    9923           0 :                                         skipping_headers = 0;
    9924             :                                 }
    9925           0 :                                 dst[i] = current_header_offset; /* record start of next line */
    9926           0 :                                 continue;
    9927             :                         }
    9928       51265 :                         if (sipdebug) {
    9929       36426 :                                 ast_debug(4, "%7s %2d [%3d]: %s\n",
    9930             :                                           req->headers < 0 ? "Header" : "Body",
    9931             :                                           i, (int) strlen(previous_header), previous_header);
    9932             :                         }
    9933       51265 :                         if (ast_strlen_zero(previous_header) && req->headers < 0) {
    9934        1081 :                                 req->headers = i;    /* record number of header lines */
    9935        1081 :                                 dst = req->line;     /* start working on the body */
    9936        1081 :                                 i = 0;
    9937        1081 :                                 lim = SIP_MAX_LINES - 1;
    9938             :                         } else {        /* move to next line, check for overflows */
    9939       50184 :                                 if (i++ == lim) {
    9940             :                                         /* if we're processing headers, then skip any remaining
    9941             :                                            headers and move on to processing the body, otherwise
    9942             :                                            we're done */
    9943           0 :                                         if (req->headers != -1) {
    9944           0 :                                                 break;
    9945             :                                         } else {
    9946           0 :                                                 req->headers = i;
    9947           0 :                                                 dst = req->line;
    9948           0 :                                                 i = 0;
    9949           0 :                                                 lim = SIP_MAX_LINES - 1;
    9950           0 :                                                 skipping_headers = 1;
    9951             :                                         }
    9952             :                                 }
    9953             :                         }
    9954       51265 :                         dst[i] = current_header_offset; /* record start of next line */
    9955             :                 }
    9956             :         }
    9957             : 
    9958             :         /* Check for last header or body line without CRLF. The RFC for SDP requires CRLF,
    9959             :            but since some devices send without, we'll be generous in what we accept. However,
    9960             :            if we've already reached the maximum number of lines for portion of the message
    9961             :            we were parsing, we can't accept any more, so just ignore it.
    9962             :         */
    9963        3330 :         previous_header = ast_str_buffer(req->data) + dst[i];
    9964        3330 :         if ((i < lim) && !ast_strlen_zero(previous_header)) {
    9965        1061 :                 if (sipdebug) {
    9966         771 :                         ast_debug(4, "%7s %2d [%3d]: %s\n",
    9967             :                                   req->headers < 0 ? "Header" : "Body",
    9968             :                                   i, (int) strlen(previous_header), previous_header );
    9969             :                 }
    9970        1061 :                 i++;
    9971             :         }
    9972             : 
    9973             :         /* update count of header or body lines */
    9974        3330 :         if (req->headers >= 0) {  /* we are in the body */
    9975        1081 :                 req->lines = i;
    9976             :         } else {                        /* no body */
    9977        2249 :                 req->headers = i;
    9978        2249 :                 req->lines = 0;
    9979             :                 /* req->data->used will be a NULL byte */
    9980        2249 :                 req->line[0] = ast_str_strlen(req->data);
    9981             :         }
    9982             : 
    9983        3330 :         if (*c) {
    9984           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Too many lines, skipping <%s>\n", c);
    9985             :         }
    9986             : 
    9987             :         /* Split up the first line parts */
    9988        3330 :         return determine_firstline_parts(req);
    9989             : }
    9990             : 
    9991             : /*!
    9992             :   \brief Determine whether a SIP message contains an SDP in its body
    9993             :   \param req the SIP request to process
    9994             :   \return 1 if SDP found, 0 if not found
    9995             : 
    9996             :   Also updates req->sdp_start and req->sdp_count to indicate where the SDP
    9997             :   lives in the message body.
    9998             : */
    9999        1486 : static int find_sdp(struct sip_request *req)
   10000             : {
   10001             :         const char *content_type;
   10002             :         const char *content_length;
   10003             :         const char *search;
   10004             :         char *boundary;
   10005             :         unsigned int x;
   10006        1486 :         int boundaryisquoted = FALSE;
   10007        1486 :         int found_application_sdp = FALSE;
   10008        1486 :         int found_end_of_headers = FALSE;
   10009             : 
   10010        1486 :         content_length = sip_get_header(req, "Content-Length");
   10011             : 
   10012        1486 :         if (!ast_strlen_zero(content_length)) {
   10013        1486 :                 if (sscanf(content_length, "%30u", &x) != 1) {
   10014           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Invalid Content-Length: %s\n", content_length);
   10015           0 :                         return 0;
   10016             :                 }
   10017             : 
   10018             :                 /* Content-Length of zero means there can't possibly be an
   10019             :                    SDP here, even if the Content-Type says there is */
   10020        1486 :                 if (x == 0)
   10021         529 :                         return 0;
   10022             :         }
   10023             : 
   10024         957 :         content_type = sip_get_header(req, "Content-Type");
   10025             : 
   10026             :         /* if the body contains only SDP, this is easy */
   10027         957 :         if (!strncasecmp(content_type, "application/sdp", 15)) {
   10028         957 :                 req->sdp_start = 0;
   10029         957 :                 req->sdp_count = req->lines;
   10030         957 :                 return req->lines ? 1 : 0;
   10031             :         }
   10032             : 
   10033             :         /* if it's not multipart/mixed, there cannot be an SDP */
   10034           0 :         if (strncasecmp(content_type, "multipart/mixed", 15))
   10035           0 :                 return 0;
   10036             : 
   10037             :         /* if there is no boundary marker, it's invalid */
   10038           0 :         if ((search = strcasestr(content_type, ";boundary=")))
   10039           0 :                 search += 10;
   10040           0 :         else if ((search = strcasestr(content_type, "; boundary=")))
   10041           0 :                 search += 11;
   10042             :         else
   10043           0 :                 return 0;
   10044             : 
   10045           0 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(search))
   10046           0 :                 return 0;
   10047             : 
   10048             :         /* If the boundary is quoted with ", remove quote */
   10049           0 :         if (*search == '\"')  {
   10050           0 :                 search++;
   10051           0 :                 boundaryisquoted = TRUE;
   10052             :         }
   10053             : 
   10054             :         /* make a duplicate of the string, with two extra characters
   10055             :            at the beginning */
   10056           0 :         boundary = ast_strdupa(search - 2);
   10057           0 :         boundary[0] = boundary[1] = '-';
   10058             :         /* Remove final quote */
   10059           0 :         if (boundaryisquoted)
   10060           0 :                 boundary[strlen(boundary) - 1] = '\0';
   10061             : 
   10062             :         /* search for the boundary marker, the empty line delimiting headers from
   10063             :            sdp part and the end boundry if it exists */

   10069           0 :                                 req->sdp_count = (x - 1) - req->sdp_start;
   10070           0 :                                 return 1;
   10071             :                         }
   10072           0 :                         found_application_sdp = FALSE;
   10073             :                 }
   10074           0 :                 if (!strcasecmp(line, "Content-Type: application/sdp"))

   10076             : 
   10077           0 :                 if (ast_strlen_zero(line)) {
   10078           0 :                         if (found_application_sdp && !found_end_of_headers){
   10079           0 :                                 req->sdp_start = x;
   10080           0 :                                 found_end_of_headers = TRUE;

   10082             :                 }
   10083             :         }

   10086           0 :                 return TRUE;

   10091             : /*! \brief Change hold state for a call */

   10093             : {

   10099          12 :                 ast_clear_flag(&dialog->flags[1], SIP_PAGE2_CALL_ONHOLD);        /* Clear both flags */
   10100          12 :                 return;
   10101             :         }
   10102             :         /* No address for RTP, we're on hold */
   10103             :

   10192             : 
   10193             : /*! \brief Process SIP SDP offer, select formats and activate media channels
   10194             :         If offer is rejected, we will not change any properties of the call
   10195             :         Return 0 on success, a negative value on errors.
   10196             :         Must be called after find_sdp().
   10197             : */
   10198         957 : static int process_sdp(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req, int t38action, int is_offer)
   10199             : {
   10200         957 :         int res = 0;
   10201             : 
   10202             :         /* Iterators for SDP parsing */
   10203         957 :         int start = req->sdp_start;
   10204         957 :         int next = start;
   10205         957 :         int iterator = start;
   10206             : 
   10207             :         /* Temporary vars for SDP parsing */
   10208         957 :         char type = '\0';
   10209         957 :         const char *value = NULL;
   10210         957 :         const char *m = NULL;           /* SDP media offer */
   10211         957 :         const char *nextm = NULL;
   10212         957 :         int len = -1;
   10213             :         struct offered_media *offer;
   10214             : 
   10215             :         /* Host information */
   10216             :         struct ast_sockaddr sessionsa;
   10217             :         struct ast_sockaddr audiosa;
   10218             :         struct ast_sockaddr videosa;
   10219             :         struct ast_sockaddr textsa;

   11217         957 : static int process_sdp_o(const char *o, struct sip_pvt *p)
   11218             : {
   11219             :         char *o_copy;
   11220             :         char *token;
   11221             :         int64_t rua_version;
   11222             : 
   11223             :         /* Store the SDP version number of remote UA. This will allow us to
   11224             :         distinguish between session modifications and session refreshes. If
   11225             :         the remote UA does not send an incremented SDP version number in a
   11226             :         subsequent RE-INVITE then that means its not changing media session.
   11227             :         The RE-INVITE may have been sent to update connected party, remote
   11228             :         target or to refresh the session (Session-Timers).  Asterisk must not
   11229             :         change media session and increment its own version number in answer
   11230             :         SDP in this case. */
   11231             : 
   11232         957 :         p->session_modify = TRUE;
   11233             : 
   11234         957 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(o)) {
   11235           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SDP syntax error. SDP without an o= line\n");
   11236           0 :                 return FALSE;
   11237             :         }
   11238             : 
   11239         957 :         o_copy = ast_strdupa(o);
   11240         957 :         token = strsep(&o_copy, " ");  /* Skip username   */
   11241         957 :         if (!o_copy) {
   11242           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SDP syntax error in o= line username\n");
   11243           0 :                 return FALSE;
   11244             :         }
   11245         957 :         token = strsep(&o_copy, " ");  /* Skip session-id */
   11246         957 :         if (!o_copy) {
   11247           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SDP syntax error in o= line session-id\n");
   11248           0 :                 return FALSE;
   11249             :         }
   11250         957 :         token = strsep(&o_copy, " ");  /* Version         */
   11251         957 :         if (!o_copy) {
   11252           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SDP syntax error in o= line\n");
   11253           0 :                 return FALSE;
   11254             :         }
   11255         957 :         if (!sscanf(token, "%30" SCNd64, &rua_version)) {
   11256           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SDP syntax error in o= line version\n");
   11257           0 :                 return FALSE;
   11258             :         }
   11259             : 
   11260             :         /* we need to check the SDP version number the other end sent us;
   11261             :          * our rules for deciding what to accept are a bit complex.
   11262             :          *
   11263             :          * 1) if 'ignoresdpversion' has been set for this dialog, then
   11264             :          *    we will just accept whatever they sent and assume it is
   11265             :          *    a modification of the session, even if it is not
   11266             :          * 2) otherwise, if this is the first SDP we've seen from them
   11267             :          *    we accept it
   11268             :          * 3) otherwise, if the new SDP version number is higher than the
   11269             :          *    old one, we accept it
   11270             :          * 4) otherwise, if this SDP is in response to us requesting a switch
   11271             :          *    to T.38, we accept the SDP, but also generate a warning message
   11272             :          *    that this peer should have the 'ignoresdpversion' option set,
   11273             :          *    because it is not following the SDP offer/answer RFC; if we did
   11274             :          *    not request a switch to T.38, then we stop parsing the SDP, as it
   11275             :          *    has not changed from the previous version
   11276             :          */
   11277             : 
   11278         957 :         if (ast_test_flag(&p->flags[1], SIP_PAGE2_IGNORESDPVERSION) ||
   11279         957 :             (p->sessionversion_remote < 0) ||
   11280         326 :             (p->sessionversion_remote < rua_version)) {
   11281         923 :                 p->sessionversion_remote = rua_version;
   11282             :         } else {
   11283          34 :                 if (p->t38.state == T38_LOCAL_REINVITE) {
   11284           0 :                         p->sessionversion_remote = rua_version;
   11285           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Call %s responded to our T.38 reinvite without changing SDP version; 'ignoresdpversion' should be set for this peer.\n", p->callid);
   11286             :                 } else {
   11287          34 :                         p->session_modify = FALSE;
   11288          34 :                         ast_debug(2, "Call %s responded to our reinvite without changing SDP version; ignoring SDP.\n", p->callid);
   11289          34 :                         return FALSE;
   11290             :                 }
   11291             :         }
   11292             : 
   11293         923 :         return TRUE;
   11294             : }
   11295             : 
   11296         924 : static int process_sdp_c(const char *c, struct ast_sockaddr *addr)
   11297             : {
   11298             :         char proto[4], host[258];
   11299             :         int af;
   11300             : 
   11301             :         /* Check for Media-description-level-address */
   11302         924 :         if (sscanf(c, "IN %3s %255s", proto, host) == 2) {
   11303         924 :                 if (!strcmp("IP4", proto)) {
   11304         918 :                         af = AF_INET;
   11305           6 :                 } else if (!strcmp("IP6", proto)) {
   11306           6 :                         af = AF_INET6;
   11307             :                 } else {
   11308           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown protocol '%s'.\n", proto);
   11309           0 :                         return FALSE;
   11310             :                 }
   11311         924 :                 if (ast_sockaddr_resolve_first_af(addr, host, 0, af)) {
   11312           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to lookup RTP Audio host in c= line, '%s'\n", c);
   11313           0 :                         return FALSE;
   11314             :                 }
   11315         924 :                 return TRUE;
   11316             :         } else {
   11317           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Invalid host in c= line, '%s'\n", c);
   11318           0 :                 return FALSE;
   11319             :         }
   11320             :         return FALSE;
   11321             : }
   11322             : 
   11323        4950 : static int process_sdp_a_sendonly(const char *a, int *sendonly)

   11325        4950 :         int found = FALSE;
   11326             :

   11329          13 :                         *sendonly = 1;

   11333           2 :                         *sendonly = 2;
   11334           2 :                 found = TRUE;
   11335        4927 :         }  else if (!strcasecmp(a, "sendrecv")) {
   11336         745 :                 if (*sendonly == -1)
   11337         715 :                         *sendonly = 0;
   11338         745 :                 found = TRUE;
   11339             :         }
   11340        4950 :         return found;

   11342             : 
   11343        5179 : static int process_sdp_a_ice(const char *a, struct sip_pvt *p, struct ast_rtp_instance *instance, int rtcp_mux_offered)
   11344             : {
   11345             :         struct ast_rtp_engine_ice *ice;
   11346        5179 :         int found = FALSE;
   11347        5179 :         char ufrag[256], pwd[256], foundation[33], transport[4], address[46], cand_type[6], relay_address[46] = "";
   11348        5179 :         struct ast_rtp_engine_ice_candidate candidate = { 0, };
   11349        5179 :         unsigned int port, relay_port = 0;
   11350             : 
   11351        5179 :         if (!instance || !(ice = ast_rtp_instance_get_ice(instance))) {
   11352         172 :                 return found;

   11880             : /*! \brief Copy SIP VIA Headers from the request to the response
   11881             : \note   If the client indicates that it wishes to know the port we received from,
   11882             :         it adds ;rport without an argument to the topmost via header. We need to
   11883             :         add the port number (from our point of view) to that parameter.
   11884             : \verbatim
   11885             :         We always add ;received=<ip address> to the topmost via header.
   11886             : \endverbatim
   11887             :         Received: RFC 3261, rport RFC 3581 */
   11888        1573 : static int copy_via_headers(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req, const struct sip_request *orig, const char *field)
   11889             : {
   11890        1573 :         int copied = 0;
   11891        1573 :         int start = 0;
   11892             : 
   11893        1573 :         for (;;) {
   11894             :                 char new[512];
   11895        3146 :                 const char *oh = __get_header(orig, field, &start);
   11896             : 
   11897        3146 :                 if (ast_strlen_zero(oh))
   11898        1573 :                         break;
   11899             : 
   11900        1573 :                 if (!copied) {  /* Only check for empty rport in topmost via header */
   11901             :                         char leftmost[512], *others, *rport;
   11902             : 
   11903             :                         /* Only work on leftmost value */
   11904        1573 :                         ast_copy_string(leftmost, oh, sizeof(leftmost));
   11905        1573 :                         others = strchr(leftmost, ',');
   11906        1573 :                         if (others)
   11907           0 :                             *others++ = '\0';
   11908             : 
   11909             :                         /* Find ;rport;  (empty request) */
   11910        1573 :                         rport = strstr(leftmost, ";rport");
   11911        1573 :                         if (rport && *(rport+6) == '=')
   11912           0 :                                 rport = NULL;           /* We already have a parameter to rport */
   11913             : 
   11914        1573 :                         if (((ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_NAT_FORCE_RPORT)) || (rport && ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_NAT_RPORT_PRESENT)))) {
   11915             :                                 /* We need to add received port - rport */
   11916             :                                 char *end;
   11917             : 
   11918          49 :                                 rport = strstr(leftmost, ";rport");

   11968             : /*! \brief Set destination from SIP URI
   11969             :  *
   11970             :  * Parse uri to h (host) and port - uri is already just the part inside the <>
   11971             :  * general form we are expecting is \verbatim sip[s]:username[:password][;parameter]@host[:port][;...] \endverbatim

   11973             :  * for SIP: uri's
   11974             :  *
   11975             :  * If there's a sips: uri scheme, TLS will be required.
   11976             :  */

   12118             : /*! \brief Test if this response needs a contact header */
   12119        1515 : static inline int resp_needs_contact(const char *msg, enum sipmethod method) {
   12120             :         /* Requirements for Contact header inclusion in responses generated
   12121             :          * from the header tables found in the following RFCs.  Where the
   12122             :          * Contact header was marked mandatory (m) or optional (o) this
   12123             :          * function returns 1.
   12124             :          *
   12125             :          * - RFC 3261 (ACK, BYE, CANCEL, INVITE, OPTIONS, REGISTER)
   12126             :          * - RFC 2976 (INFO)
   12127             :          * - RFC 3262 (PRACK)
   12128             :          * - RFC 3265 (SUBSCRIBE, NOTIFY)
   12129             :          * - RFC 3311 (UPDATE)
   12130             :          * - RFC 3428 (MESSAGE)
   12131             :          * - RFC 3515 (REFER)
   12132             :          * - RFC 3903 (PUBLISH)
   12133             :          */
   12134             : 
   12135        1515 :         switch (method) {
   12136             :                 /* 1xx, 2xx, 3xx, 485 */
   12137        1115 :                 case SIP_INVITE:
   12138             :                 case SIP_UPDATE:
   12139             :                 case SIP_SUBSCRIBE:
   12140             :                 case SIP_NOTIFY:
   12141        1115 :                         if ((msg[0] >= '1' && msg[0] <= '3') || !strncmp(msg, "485", 3))
   12142        1014 :                                 return 1;
   12143         101 :                         break;
   12144             : 
   12145             :                 /* 2xx, 3xx, 485 */
   12146          25 :                 case SIP_REGISTER:
   12147             :                 case SIP_OPTIONS:
   12148          25 :                         if (msg[0] == '2' || msg[0] == '3' || !strncmp(msg, "485", 3))
   12149           1 :                                 return 1;
   12150          24 :                         break;
   12151             : 
   12152             :                 /* 3xx, 485 */
   12153         310 :                 case SIP_BYE:
   12154             :                 case SIP_PRACK:
   12155             :                 case SIP_MESSAGE:
   12156             :                 case SIP_PUBLISH:
   12157         310 :                         if (msg[0] == '3' || !strncmp(msg, "485", 3))
   12158           0 :                                 return 1;
   12159         310 :                         break;
   12160             : 
   12161             :                 /* 2xx, 3xx, 4xx, 5xx, 6xx */
   12162           5 :                 case SIP_REFER:
   12163           5 :                         if (msg[0] >= '2' && msg[0] <= '6')
   12164           5 :                                 return 1;
   12165           0 :                         break;
   12166             : 
   12167             :                 /* contact will not be included for everything else */
   12168          60 :                 case SIP_ACK:
   12169             :                 case SIP_CANCEL:
   12170             :                 case SIP_INFO:
   12171             :                 case SIP_PING:
   12172             :                 default:
   12173          60 :                         return 0;
   12174             :         }
   12175         435 :         return 0;
   12176             : }

   12178             : /*! \brief Prepare SIP response packet */
   12179        1573 : static int respprep(struct sip_request *resp, struct sip_pvt *p, const char *msg, const struct sip_request *req)
   12180             : {
   12181             :         char newto[256];
   12182             :         const char *ot;
   12183             : 
   12184        1573 :         init_resp(resp, msg);
   12185        1573 :         copy_via_headers(p, resp, req, "Via");
   12186        1573 :         if (msg[0] == '1' || msg[0] == '2')
   12187        1427 :                 copy_all_header(resp, req, "Record-Route");
   12188        1573 :         copy_header(resp, req, "From");
   12189        1573 :         ot = sip_get_header(req, "To");
   12190        1573 :         if (!strcasestr(ot, "tag=") && strncmp(msg, "100", 3)) {
   12191             :                 /* Add the proper tag if we don't have it already.  If they have specified
   12192             :                    their tag, use it.  Otherwise, use our own tag */
   12193         572 :                 if (!ast_strlen_zero(p->theirtag) && ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_OUTGOING))
   12194           1 :                         snprintf(newto, sizeof(newto), "%s;tag=%s", ot, p->theirtag);
   12195         571 :                 else if (p->tag && !ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_OUTGOING))
   12196         571 :                         snprintf(newto, sizeof(newto), "%s;tag=%s", ot, p->tag);
   12197             :                 else
   12198           0 :                         ast_copy_string(newto, ot, sizeof(newto));
   12199         572 :                 ot = newto;
   12200             :         }
   12201        1573 :         add_header(resp, "To", ot);
   12202        1573 :         copy_header(resp, req, "Call-ID");
   12203        1573 :         copy_header(resp, req, "CSeq");
   12204        1573 :         if (!ast_strlen_zero(global_useragent))
   12205        1573 :                 add_header(resp, "Server", global_useragent);
   12206        1573 :         add_header(resp, "Allow", ALLOWED_METHODS);
   12207        1573 :         add_supported(p, resp);
   12208             : 
   12209             :         /* If this is an invite, add Session-Timers related headers if the feature is active for this session */
   12210        1573 :         if (p->method == SIP_INVITE && p->stimer && p->stimer->st_active == TRUE) {
   12211             :                 char se_hdr[256];
   12212         730 :                 snprintf(se_hdr, sizeof(se_hdr), "%d;refresher=%s", p->stimer->st_interval,
   12213         730 :                         p->stimer->st_ref == SESSION_TIMER_REFRESHER_US ? "uas" : "uac");
   12214         730 :                 add_header(resp, "Session-Expires", se_hdr);
   12215             :                 /* RFC 2048, Section 9
   12216             :                  * If the refresher parameter in the Session-Expires header field in the
   12217             :                  * 2xx response has a value of 'uac', the UAS MUST place a Require
   12218             :                  * header field into the response with the value 'timer'.
   12219             :                  * ...
   12220             :                  * If the refresher parameter in
   12221             :                  * the 2xx response has a value of 'uas' and the Supported header field

   12877           0 :                         event = digit - '0';

   12879           0 :                         event = 10;
   12880           0 :                 } else if (digit == '#') {
   12881           0 :                         event = 11;
   12882           0 :                 } else if ('A' <= digit && digit <= 'D') {
   12883           0 :                         event = 12 + digit - 'A';
   12884           0 :                 } else if ('a' <= digit && digit <= 'd') {

   13038             : /*! \brief Add ICE attributes to SDP */
   13039           3 : static void add_ice_to_sdp(struct ast_rtp_instance *instance, struct ast_str **a_buf)
   13040             : {
   13041           3 :         struct ast_rtp_engine_ice *ice = ast_rtp_instance_get_ice(instance);

   13046             :

   13051             :

   13058             : 
   13059           3 :         i = ao2_iterator_init(candidates, 0);
   13060             :

   13446             : /*! \brief Add Session Description Protocol message
   13447             : 
   13448             :     If oldsdp is TRUE, then the SDP version number is not incremented. This mechanism
   13449             :     is used in Session-Timers where RE-INVITEs are used for refreshing SIP sessions
   13450             :     without modifying the media session in any way.
   13451             : */
   13452         954 : static enum sip_result add_sdp(struct sip_request *resp, struct sip_pvt *p, int oldsdp, int add_audio, int add_t38)

   14133             : 
   14134             : /*! \brief Transmit reinvite with SDP
   14135             : \note   A re-invite is basically a new INVITE with the same CALL-ID and TAG as the
   14136             :         INVITE that opened the SIP dialogue
   14137             :         We reinvite so that the audio stream (RTP) go directly between
   14138             :         the SIP UAs. SIP Signalling stays with * in the path.
   14139             : 
   14140             :         If t38version is TRUE, we send T38 SDP for re-invite from audio/video to
   14141             :         T38 UDPTL transmission on the channel
   14142             : 
   14143             :     If oldsdp is TRUE then the SDP version number is not incremented. This
   14144             :     is needed for Session-Timers so we can send a re-invite to refresh the
   14145             :     SIP session without modifying the media session.
   14146             : */
   14147         155 : static int transmit_reinvite_with_sdp(struct sip_pvt *p, int t38version, int oldsdp)
   14148             : {
   14149             :         struct sip_request req;
   14150             : 
   14151         155 :         if (t38version) {
   14152             :                 /* Force media to go through us for T.38. */
   14153          19 :                 memset(&p->redirip, 0, sizeof(p->redirip));
   14154             :         }
   14155         155 :         if (p->rtp) {
   14156         155 :                 if (t38version) {
   14157             :                         /* Silence RTCP while audio RTP is inactive */
   14158          19 :                         ast_rtp_instance_set_prop(p->rtp, AST_RTP_PROPERTY_RTCP, AST_RTP_INSTANCE_RTCP_DISABLED);
   14159          19 :                         if (p->owner) {
   14160             :                                 /* Prevent audio RTCP reads */
   14161          19 :                                 ast_channel_set_fd(p->owner, SIP_AUDIO_RTCP_FD, -1);
   14162             :                         }
   14163         136 :                 } else if (ast_sockaddr_isnull(&p->redirip)) {
   14164             :                         /* Enable RTCP since it will be inactive if we're coming back
   14165             :                          * with this reinvite */
   14166          72 :                         ast_rtp_instance_set_prop(p->rtp, AST_RTP_PROPERTY_RTCP, AST_RTP_INSTANCE_RTCP_STANDARD);
   14167          72 :                         if (p->owner) {
   14168             :                                 /* Enable audio RTCP reads */
   14169          70 :                                 ast_channel_set_fd(p->owner, SIP_AUDIO_RTCP_FD, ast_rtp_instance_fd(p->rtp, 1));
   14170             :                         }
   14171             :                 }
   14172             :         }
   14173             : 
   14174         155 :         reqprep(&req, p, ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_REINVITE_UPDATE) ?  SIP_UPDATE : SIP_INVITE, 0, 1);
   14175             : 
   14176         155 :         add_header(&req, "Allow", ALLOWED_METHODS);
   14177         155 :         add_supported(p, &req);
   14178         155 :         if (sipdebug) {
   14179         104 :                 if (oldsdp == TRUE)
   14180           2 :                         add_header(&req, "X-asterisk-Info", "SIP re-invite (Session-Timers)");
   14181             :                 else
   14182         102 :                         add_header(&req, "X-asterisk-Info", "SIP re-invite (External RTP bridge)");
   14183             :         }
   14184             : 
   14185         155 :         if (ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_SENDRPID))
   14186          42 :                 add_rpid(&req, p);
   14187             : 
   14188         155 :         if (p->do_history) {
   14189           0 :                 append_history(p, "ReInv", "Re-invite sent");
   14190             :         }
   14191             : 
   14192         155 :         offered_media_list_destroy(p);
   14193             : 
   14194         155 :         try_suggested_sip_codec(p);
   14195         155 :         if (t38version) {
   14196          19 :                 add_sdp(&req, p, oldsdp, FALSE, TRUE);
   14197             :         } else {
   14198         136 :                 add_sdp(&req, p, oldsdp, TRUE, FALSE);
   14199             :         }
   14200             : 
   14201             :         /* Use this as the basis */

   14205         155 :         p->ongoing_reinvite = 1;

   14209             : /* \brief Remove URI parameters at end of URI, not in username part though */

   14238             : /*!
   14239             :  * \brief Determine if, as a UAS, we need to use a SIPS Contact.
   14240             :  *
   14241             :  * This uses the rules defined in RFC 3261 section 12.1.1 to
   14242             :  * determine if a SIPS URI should be used as the Contact header
   14243             :  * when responding to incoming SIP requests.
   14244             :  *
   14245             :  * \param req The incoming SIP request
   14246             :  * \retval 0 SIPS is not required
   14247             :  * \retval 1 SIPS is required
   14248             :  */
   14249         836 : static int uas_sips_contact(struct sip_request *req)
   14250             : {
   14251         836 :         const char *record_route = sip_get_header(req, "Record-Route");
   14252             : 
   14253         836 :         if (!strncmp(REQ_OFFSET_TO_STR(req, rlpart2), "sips:", 5)) {
   14254           0 :                 return 1;
   14255             :         }
   14256             : 
   14257         836 :         if (record_route) {
   14258         836 :                 char *record_route_uri = get_in_brackets(ast_strdupa(record_route));
   14259             : 
   14260         836 :                 if (!strncmp(record_route_uri, "sips:", 5)) {
   14261           0 :                         return 1;
   14262             :                 }
   14263             :         } else {
   14264           0 :                 const char *contact = sip_get_header(req, "Contact");
   14265           0 :                 char *contact_uri = get_in_brackets(ast_strdupa(contact));
   14266             : 
   14267           0 :                 if (!strncmp(contact_uri, "sips:", 5)) {
   14268           0 :                         return 1;
   14269             :                 }
   14270             :         }
   14271             : 
   14272         836 :         return 0;
   14273             : }
   14274             : 
   14275             : /*!
   14276             :  * \brief Determine if, as a UAC, we need to use a SIPS Contact.
   14277             :  *
   14278             :  * This uses the rules defined in RFC 3621 section 8.1.1.8 to
   14279             :  * determine if a SIPS URI should be used as the Contact header
   14280             :  * on our outgoing request.
   14281             :  *
   14282             :  * \param req The outgoing SIP request
   14283             :  * \retval 0 SIPS is not required
   14284             :  * \retval 1 SIPS is required
   14285             :  */
   14286         327 : static int uac_sips_contact(struct sip_request *req)
   14287             : {
   14288         327 :         const char *route = sip_get_header(req, "Route");
   14289             :

   14292             :         }

   14295         327 :                 char *route_uri = get_in_brackets(ast_strdupa(route));
   14296             :

   14298           0 :                         return 1;
   14299             :                 }
   14300             :         }
   14301             : 
   14302         327 :         return 0;
   14303             : }
   14304             : 
   14305             : /*!
   14306             :  * \brief Build contact header
   14307             :  *
   14308             :  * This is the Contact header that we send out in SIP requests and responses
   14309             :  * involving this sip_pvt.
   14310             :  *
   14311             :  * The incoming parameter is used to tell if we are building the request parameter
   14312             :  * is an incoming SIP request that we are building the Contact header in response to,
   14313             :  * or if the req parameter is an outbound SIP request that we will later be adding
   14314             :  * the Contact header to.
   14315             :  *
   14316             :  * \param p The sip_pvt where the built Contact will be saved.
   14317             :  * \param req The request that triggered the creation of a Contact header.
   14318             :  * \param incoming Indicates if the Contact header is being created for a response to an incoming request
   14319             :  */

   14681             : /*!
   14682             :  * \brief Build REFER/INVITE/OPTIONS/SUBSCRIBE message and transmit it
   14683             :  * \param p sip_pvt structure
   14684             :  * \param sipmethod
   14685             :  * \param sdp unknown
   14686             :  * \param init 0 = Prepare request within dialog, 1= prepare request, new branch,
   14687             :  *  2= prepare new request and new dialog. do_proxy_auth calls this with init!=2
   14688             :  * \param explicit_uri
   14689             : */
   14690         306 : static int transmit_invite(struct sip_pvt *p, int sipmethod, int sdp, int init, const char * const explicit_uri)
   14691             : {
   14692             :         struct sip_request req;
   14693             :         struct ast_variable *var;
   14694             : 
   14695         306 :         if (init) {/* Bump branch even on initial requests */
   14696         306 :                 p->branch ^= ast_random();
   14697         306 :                 p->invite_branch = p->branch;
   14698         306 :                 build_via(p);
   14699             :         }
   14700         306 :         if (init > 1) {
   14701         299 :                 initreqprep(&req, p, sipmethod, explicit_uri);
   14702             :         } else {
   14703             :                 /* If init=1, we should not generate a new branch. If it's 0, we need a new branch. */
   14704           7 :                 reqprep(&req, p, sipmethod, 0, init ? 0 : 1);
   14705             :         }
   14706             : 
   14707         306 :         if (p->options && p->options->auth) {
   14708           6 :                 add_header(&req, p->options->authheader, p->options->auth);
   14709             :         }
   14710         306 :         add_date(&req);
   14711         306 :         if (sipmethod == SIP_REFER && p->refer) {    /* Call transfer */
   14712           0 :                 if (!ast_strlen_zero(p->refer->refer_to)) {
   14713           0 :                         add_header(&req, "Refer-To", p->refer->refer_to);
   14714             :                 }
   14715           0 :                 if (!ast_strlen_zero(p->refer->referred_by)) {
   14716           0 :                         add_header(&req, "Referred-By", p->refer->referred_by);
   14717             :                 }
   14718         306 :         } else if (sipmethod == SIP_SUBSCRIBE) {
   14719           1 :                 if (p->subscribed == MWI_NOTIFICATION) {
   14720           1 :                         add_header(&req, "Event", "message-summary");

   15155           3 :                 break;

   15498             :         /* Send as XMIT_CRITICAL as we may never receive a 200 OK Response which clears p->pendinginvite.
   15499             :          *
   15500             :          * extensionstate_update() uses p->pendinginvite for queuing control.
   15501             :          * Updates stall if pendinginvite <> 0.
   15502             :          *
   15503             :          * The most appropriate solution is to remove the subscription when the NOTIFY transaction fails.
   15504             :          * The client will re-subscribe after restarting or maxexpiry timeout.
   15505             :          */
   15506             : 
   15507             :         /* RFC6665 4.2.2.  Sending State Information to Subscribers
   15508             :          * If the NOTIFY request fails due to expiration of SIP Timer F (transaction timeout),
   15509             :          * the notifier SHOULD remove the subscription.
   15510             :          */
   15511          20 :         return send_request(p, &req, XMIT_CRITICAL, p->ocseq);

   15513             : 
   15514             : /*! \brief Notify user of messages waiting in voicemail (RFC3842)
   15515             : \note   - Notification only works for registered peers with mailbox= definitions
   15516             :         in sip.conf
   15517             :         - We use the SIP Event package message-summary
   15518             :          MIME type defaults to  "application/simple-message-summary";
   15519             :  */

   15527             :

   15529           0 :         add_header(&req, "Event", "message-summary");
   15530           0 :         add_header(&req, "Content-Type", default_notifymime);
   15531           0 :         ast_str_append(&out, 0, "Messages-Waiting: %s\r\n", newmsgs ? "yes" : "no");

   15793             : 
   15794             : /*!
   15795             :  * \brief Update registration with SIP Proxy.
   15796             :  *
   15797             :  * \details
   15798             :  * Called from the scheduler when the previous registration expires,
   15799             :  * so we don't have to cancel the pending event.
   15800             :  * We assume the reference so the sip_registry is valid, since it
   15801             :  * is stored in the scheduled event anyways.
   15802             :  *
   15803             :  * \note Run by the sched thread.
   15804             :  */
   15805           7 : static int sip_reregister(const void *data)
   15806             : {
   15807             :         /* if we are here, we know that we need to reregister. */
   15808           7 :         struct sip_registry *r = (struct sip_registry *) data;
   15809             : 
   15810           7 :         if (r->call && r->call->do_history) {
   15811           0 :                 append_history(r->call, "RegistryRenew", "Account: %s@%s", r->username, r->hostname);
   15812             :         }
   15813             :         /* Since registry's are only added/removed by the monitor thread, this
   15814             :            may be overkill to reference/dereference at all here */
   15815           7 :         if (sipdebug) {
   15816           3 :                 ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "   -- Re-registration for  %s@%s\n", r->username, r->hostname);
   15817             :         }
   15818             : 
   15819           7 :         r->expire = -1;
   15820           7 :         r->expiry = r->configured_expiry;
   15821           7 :         switch (r->regstate) {
   15822           4 :         case REG_STATE_UNREGISTERED:
   15823             :         case REG_STATE_REGSENT:
   15824             :         case REG_STATE_AUTHSENT:
   15825           4 :                 break;
   15826           0 :         case REG_STATE_REJECTED:
   15827             :         case REG_STATE_NOAUTH:
   15828             :         case REG_STATE_FAILED:
   15829             :                 /* Restarting registration as unregistered */
   15830           0 :                 r->regstate = REG_STATE_UNREGISTERED;
   15831           0 :                 break;
   15832           3 :         case REG_STATE_TIMEOUT:
   15833             :         case REG_STATE_REGISTERED:
   15834             :                 /* Registration needs to be renewed. */
   15835           3 :                 r->regstate = REG_STATE_TIMEOUT;
   15836           3 :                 break;
   15837             :         }
   15838           7 :         __sip_do_register(r);
   15839           7 :         ao2_t_ref(r, -1, "Scheduled reregister timeout complete");
   15840           7 :         return 0;
   15841             : }
   15842             : 
   15843             : /*! \brief Register with SIP proxy
   15844             :         \return see \ref __sip_xmit

   15848             :         int res;

   15853             : 
   15854             : struct reregister_data {
   15855             :         struct sip_registry *reg;
   15856             :         int ms;
   15857             : };
   15858             : 
   15859             : /* Run by the sched thread. */
   15860           9 : static int __start_reregister_timeout(const void *data)
   15861             : {
   15862           9 :         struct reregister_data *sched_data = (void *) data;
   15863           9 :         struct sip_registry *reg = sched_data->reg;

   15881             :

   15900             : 
   15901             : /*!
   15902             :  * \brief Registration request timeout, register again
   15903             :  *
   15904             :  * \details
   15905             :  * Registered as a timeout handler during transmit_register(),
   15906             :  * to retransmit the packet if a reply does not come back.
   15907             :  *
   15908             :  * \note This is called by the scheduler so the event is not pending anymore when
   15909             :  * we are called.
   15910             :  *
   15911             :  * \note Run by the sched thread.
   15912             :  */
   15913           1 : static int sip_reg_timeout(const void *data)
   15914             : {
   15915           1 :         struct sip_registry *r = (struct sip_registry *)data; /* the ref count should have been bumped when the sched item was added */
   15916             :         struct sip_pvt *p;
   15917             : 
   15918           1 :         switch (r->regstate) {
   15919           1 :         case REG_STATE_UNREGISTERED:
   15920             :         case REG_STATE_REGSENT:
   15921             :         case REG_STATE_AUTHSENT:
   15922             :         case REG_STATE_TIMEOUT:
   15923           1 :                 break;
   15924           0 :         default:
   15925             :                 /*
   15926             :                  * Registration completed because we got a request response
   15927             :                  * and we couldn't stop the scheduled entry in time.
   15928             :                  */
   15929           0 :                 r->timeout = -1;
   15930           0 :                 ao2_t_ref(r, -1, "Scheduled register timeout completed early");
   15931           0 :                 return 0;
   15932             :         }
   15933             : 
   15934           1 :         if (r->dnsmgr) {
   15935             :                 /* If the registration has timed out, maybe the IP changed.  Force a refresh. */
   15936           0 :                 ast_dnsmgr_refresh(r->dnsmgr);
   15937             :         }
   15938             : 
   15939             :         /* If the initial tranmission failed, we may not have an existing dialog,
   15940             :          * so it is possible that r->call == NULL.
   15941             :          * Otherwise destroy it, as we have a timeout so we don't want it.
   15942             :          */
   15943           1 :         if (r->call) {
   15944             :                 /* Unlink us, destroy old call.  Locking is not relevant here because all this happens
   15945             :                    in the single SIP manager thread. */
   15946           1 :                 p = r->call;
   15947           1 :                 sip_pvt_lock(p);
   15948           1 :                 pvt_set_needdestroy(p, "registration timeout");
   15949             :                 /* Pretend to ACK anything just in case */
   15950           1 :                 __sip_pretend_ack(p);
   15951           1 :                 sip_pvt_unlock(p);
   15952             : 
   15953             :                 /* decouple the two objects */
   15954             :                 /* p->registry == r, so r has 2 refs, and the unref won't take the object away */
   15955           1 :                 ao2_t_replace(p->registry, NULL, "p->registry unreffed");
   15956           1 :                 r->call = dialog_unref(r->call, "unrefing r->call");
   15957             :         }
   15958             :         /* If we have a limit, stop registration and give up */
   15959           1 :         r->timeout = -1;
   15960           1 :         if (global_regattempts_max && r->regattempts >= global_regattempts_max) {
   15961             :                 /* Ok, enough is enough. Don't try any more */
   15962             :                 /* We could add an external notification here...
   15963             :                         steal it from app_voicemail :-) */
   15964           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "   -- Last Registration Attempt #%d failed, Giving up forever trying to register '%s@%s'\n", r->regattempts, r->username, r->hostname);
   15965           0 :                 r->regstate = REG_STATE_FAILED;
   15966             :         } else {
   15967           1 :                 r->regstate = REG_STATE_UNREGISTERED;

   16772             : /*!
   16773             :  * \brief Parses SIP reason header according to RFC3326 and sets channel's hangupcause if configured so
   16774             :  *  and header present
   16775             :  *
   16776             :  * \note This is used in BYE and CANCEL request and SIP response, but according to RFC3326 it could
   16777             :  *       appear in any request, but makes not a lot of sense in others than BYE or CANCEL.
   16778             :  *       Currently only implemented for Q.850 status codes.
   16779             :  * \retval 0 success
   16780             :  * \retval -1 on failure or if not configured
   16781             :  */
   16782        1154 : static int use_reason_header(struct sip_pvt *pvt, struct sip_request *req)
   16783             : {
   16784             :         int ret, cause;
   16785             :         const char *rp, *rh;
   16786             : 
   16787        1154 :         if (!pvt->owner) {
   16788          11 :                 return -1;
   16789             :         }
   16790             : 
   16791        1143 :         if (!ast_test_flag(&pvt->flags[1], SIP_PAGE2_Q850_REASON) ||
   16792           0 :                 !(rh = sip_get_header(req, "Reason"))) {
   16793        1143 :                 return -1;
   16794             :         }
   16795             : 
   16796           0 :         rh = ast_skip_blanks(rh);
   16797           0 :         if (strncasecmp(rh, "Q.850", 5)) {
   16798           0 :                 return -1;
   16799             :         }
   16800             : 
   16801           0 :         ret = -1;
   16802           0 :         cause = ast_channel_hangupcause(pvt->owner);
   16803           0 :         rp = strstr(rh, "cause=");
   16804           0 :         if (rp && sscanf(rp + 6, "%3d", &cause) == 1) {
   16805           0 :                 ret = 0;
   16806           0 :                 ast_channel_hangupcause_set(pvt->owner, cause & 0x7f);
   16807           0 :                 if (req->debug) {
   16808           0 :                         ast_verbose("Using Reason header for cause code: %d\n",
   16809             :                                                 ast_channel_hangupcause(pvt->owner));
   16810             :                 }
   16811             :         }
   16812           0 :         return ret;
   16813             : }
   16814             : 
   16815             : /*! \brief parse uri in a way that allows semicolon stripping if legacy mode is enabled
   16816             :  *
   16817             :  * \note This calls parse_uri which has the unexpected property that passing more
   16818             :  *       arguments results in more splitting. Most common is to leave out the pass
   16819             :  *       argument, causing user to contain user:pass if available.
   16820             :  */
   16821        1693 : static int parse_uri_legacy_check(char *uri, const char *scheme, char **user, char **pass, char **hostport, char **transport)
   16822             : {
   16823        1693 :         int ret = parse_uri(uri, scheme, user, pass, hostport, transport);
   16824        1693 :         if (sip_cfg.legacy_useroption_parsing) { /* if legacy mode is active, strip semis from the user field */
   16825             :                 char *p;
   16826           0 :                 if ((p = strchr(uri, (int)';'))) {
   16827           0 :                         *p = '\0';
   16828             :                 }
   16829             :         }
   16830        1693 :         return ret;
   16831             : }
   16832             :

   17235             : /*! \brief builds the sip_pvt's nonce field which is used for the authentication
   17236             :  *  challenge.  When forceupdate is not set, the nonce is only updated if
   17237             :  *  the current one is stale.  In this case, a stalenonce is one which
   17238             :  *  has already received a response, if a nonce has not received a response
   17239             :  *  it is not always necessary or beneficial to create a new one. */
   17240             :

   17246             :         }
   17247          43 : }
   17248             : 
   17249             : /*! \brief Takes the digest response and parses it */
   17250          46 : void sip_digest_parser(char *c, struct digestkeys *keys)
   17251             : {
   17252          46 :         struct digestkeys *i = i;
   17253             : 
   17254         547 :         while(c && *(c = ast_skip_blanks(c)) ) { /* lookup for keys */
   17255        2045 :                 for (i = keys; i->key != NULL; i++) {
   17256        1728 :                         const char *separator = ",";    /* default */
   17257             : 
   17258        1728 :                         if (strncasecmp(c, i->key, strlen(i->key)) != 0) {
   17259        1544 :                                 continue;
   17260             :                         }
   17261             :                         /* Found. Skip keyword, take text in quotes or up to the separator. */
   17262         184 :                         c += strlen(i->key);
   17263         184 :                         if (*c == '"') { /* in quotes. Skip first and look for last */

   17270             :                 }

   17272         317 :                         strsep(&c, " ,");
   17273             :                 }
   17274             :         }

   17277             : /*! \brief  Check user authorization from peer definition
   17278             :         Some actions, like REGISTER and INVITEs from peers require

   17647             : 
   17648             : /*! \brief Send a fake 401 Unauthorized response when the administrator
   17649             :   wants to hide the names of local devices  from fishers
   17650             :  */
   17651           6 : static void transmit_fake_auth_response(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req, enum xmittype reliable)
   17652             : {
   17653             :         /* We have to emulate EXACTLY what we'd get with a good peer
   17654             :          * and a bad password, or else we leak information. */
   17655           6 :         const char *response = "401 Unauthorized";
   17656           6 :         const char *reqheader = "Authorization";
   17657           6 :         const char *respheader = "WWW-Authenticate";
   17658             :         const char *authtoken;
   17659             :         struct ast_str *buf;
   17660             :         char *c;
   17661             : 
   17662             :         /* table of recognised keywords, and their value in the digest */
   17663             :         enum keys { K_NONCE, K_LAST };
   17664             :         struct x {
   17665             :                 const char *key;
   17666             :                 const char *s;
   17667           6 :         } *i, keys[] = {
   17668             :                 [K_NONCE] = { "nonce=", "" },
   17669             :                 [K_LAST] = { NULL, NULL}
   17670             :         };
   17671             : 
   17672           6 :         authtoken = sip_get_header(req, reqheader);
   17673           6 :         if (req->ignore && !ast_strlen_zero(p->nonce) && ast_strlen_zero(authtoken)) {
   17674             :                 /* This is a retransmitted invite/register/etc, don't reconstruct authentication
   17675             :                  * information */
   17676           0 :                 transmit_response_with_auth(p, response, req, p->nonce, reliable, respheader, 0);
   17677             :                 /* Schedule auto destroy in 32 seconds (according to RFC 3261) */
   17678           0 :                 sip_scheddestroy(p, DEFAULT_TRANS_TIMEOUT);
   17679           3 :                 return;
   17680           6 :         } else if (ast_strlen_zero(p->nonce) || ast_strlen_zero(authtoken)) {
   17681             :                 /* We have no auth, so issue challenge and request authentication */
   17682           3 :                 build_nonce(p, 1);
   17683           3 :                 transmit_response_with_auth(p, response, req, p->nonce, reliable, respheader, 0);
   17684             :                 /* Schedule auto destroy in 32 seconds */
   17685           3 :                 sip_scheddestroy(p, DEFAULT_TRANS_TIMEOUT);
   17686           3 :                 return;
   17687             :         }
   17688             : 
   17689           3 :         if (!(buf = ast_str_thread_get(&check_auth_buf, CHECK_AUTH_BUF_INITLEN))) {
   17690           0 :                 __transmit_response(p, "403 Forbidden", &p->initreq, reliable);
   17691           0 :                 return;
   17692             :         }
   17693             : 
   17694             :         /* Make a copy of the response and parse it */

   17696           0 :                 __transmit_response(p, "403 Forbidden", &p->initreq, reliable);
   17697           0 :                 return;
   17698             :         }
   17699             : 
   17700           3 :         c = ast_str_buffer(buf);

   17704          24 :                         const char *separator = ",";  /* default */
   17705             :

   17707          21 :                                 continue;
   17708             :                         }

   17711           3 :                         if (*c == '"') { /* in quotes. Skip first and look for last */
   17712           3 :                                 c++;
   17713           3 :                                 separator = "\"";
   17714             :                         }
   17715           3 :                         i->s = c;
   17716           3 :                         strsep(&c, separator);
   17717           3 :                         break;

   17737             : 
   17738             : /*!
   17739             :  * Terminate the uri at the first ';' or space.
   17740             :  * Technically we should ignore escaped space per RFC3261 (19.1.1 etc)
   17741             :  * but don't do it for the time being. Remember the uri format is:
   17742             :  * (User-parameters was added after RFC 3261)
   17743             :  *\verbatim
   17744             :  *
   17745             :  *      sip:user:password;user-parameters@host:port;uri-parameters?headers
   17746             :  *      sips:user:password;user-parameters@host:port;uri-parameters?headers
   17747             :  *
   17748             :  *\endverbatim
   17749             :  * \todo As this function does not support user-parameters, it's considered broken
   17750             :  *      and needs fixing.
   17751             :  */
   17752         500 : static char *terminate_uri(char *uri)
   17753             : {
   17754         500 :         char *t = uri;
   17755       12258 :         while (*t && *t > ' ' && *t != ';') {
   17756       11758 :                 t++;
   17757             :         }
   17758         500 :         *t = '\0';
   17759         500 :         return uri;
   17760             : }
   17761             : 
   17762             : /*! \brief Terminate a host:port at the ':'
   17763             :  * \param hostport The address of the hostport string

   17765             :  * \note In the case of a bracket-enclosed IPv6 address, the hostport variable
   17766             :  * will contain the non-bracketed host as a result of calling this function.

   17768        1253 : static void extract_host_from_hostport(char **hostport)
   17769             : {

   17771        1253 :         ast_sockaddr_split_hostport(*hostport, hostport, &dont_care, PARSE_PORT_IGNORE);

   17790             : /*!
   17791             :  * \brief Verify registration of user
   17792             :  *
   17793             :  * \details
   17794             :  * - Registration is done in several steps, first a REGISTER without auth
   17795             :  *   to get a challenge (nonce) then a second one with auth
   17796             :  * - Registration requests are only matched with peers that are marked as "dynamic"
   17797             :  */

   18093             : /*! \brief Translate referring cause */
   18094           5 : static void sip_set_redirstr(struct sip_pvt *p, char *reason) {
   18095             : 
   18096           5 :         if (!strcmp(reason, "unknown")) {
   18097           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "UNKNOWN");
   18098           5 :         } else if (!strcmp(reason, "user-busy")) {
   18099           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "BUSY");
   18100           5 :         } else if (!strcmp(reason, "no-answer")) {
   18101           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "NOANSWER");
   18102           5 :         } else if (!strcmp(reason, "unavailable")) {
   18103           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "UNREACHABLE");
   18104           5 :         } else if (!strcmp(reason, "unconditional")) {
   18105           3 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "UNCONDITIONAL");
   18106           2 :         } else if (!strcmp(reason, "time-of-day")) {
   18107           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "UNKNOWN");
   18108           2 :         } else if (!strcmp(reason, "do-not-disturb")) {
   18109           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "UNKNOWN");
   18110           2 :         } else if (!strcmp(reason, "deflection")) {
   18111           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "UNKNOWN");
   18112           2 :         } else if (!strcmp(reason, "follow-me")) {
   18113           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "UNKNOWN");
   18114           2 :         } else if (!strcmp(reason, "out-of-service")) {
   18115           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "UNREACHABLE");
   18116           2 :         } else if (!strcmp(reason, "away")) {
   18117           0 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "UNREACHABLE");
   18118             :         } else {
   18119           2 :                 ast_string_field_set(p, redircause, "UNKNOWN");
   18120             :         }
   18121           5 : }
   18122             : 
   18123             : /*! \brief Parse the parts of the P-Asserted-Identity header
   18124             :  * on an incoming packet. Returns 1 if a valid header is found
   18125             :  * and it is different from the current caller id.
   18126             :  */
   18127          24 : static int get_pai(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req)
   18128             : {
   18129             :         char pai[256];

   18319             : /*! \brief Get referring dnis

   18431             : /*!
   18432             :  * \brief Find out who the call is for.
   18433             :  *
   18434             :  * \details
   18435             :  * We use the request uri as a destination.
   18436             :  * This code assumes authentication has been done, so that the
   18437             :  * device (peer/user) context is already set.
   18438             :  *
   18439             :  * \return 0 on success (found a matching extension), non-zero on failure
   18440             :  *
   18441             :  * \note If the incoming uri is a SIPS: uri, we are required to carry this across
   18442             :  * the dialplan, so that the outbound call also is a sips: call or encrypted
   18443             :  * IAX2 call. If that's not available, the call should FAIL.
   18444             :  */

   18613             : /*! \brief Find a companion dialog based on Replaces information
   18614             :  *
   18615             :  * This information may come from a Refer-To header in a REFER or from
   18616             :  * a Replaces header in an INVITE.
   18617             :  *
   18618             :  * This function will find the appropriate sip_pvt and increment the refcount
   18619             :  * of both the sip_pvt and its owner channel. These two references are returned
   18620             :  * in the out parameters
   18621             :  *
   18622             :  * \param callid Callid to search for
   18623             :  * \param totag to-tag parameter from Replaces
   18624             :  * \param fromtag from-tag parameter from Replaces
   18625             :  * \param[out] out_pvt The found sip_pvt.
   18626             :  * \param[out] out_chan The found sip_pvt's owner channel.
   18627             :  * \retval 0 Success
   18628             :  * \retval non-zero Failure
   18629             :  */
   18630           0 : static int get_sip_pvt_from_replaces(const char *callid, const char *totag,
   18631             :                 const char *fromtag, struct sip_pvt **out_pvt, struct ast_channel **out_chan)
   18632             : {
   18633           0 :         RAII_VAR(struct sip_pvt *, sip_pvt_ptr, NULL, ao2_cleanup);
   18634           0 :         struct sip_pvt tmp_dialog = {
   18635             :                 .callid = callid,
   18636             :         };
   18637             : 
   18638           0 :         if (totag) {
   18639           0 :                 ast_debug(4, "Looking for callid %s (fromtag %s totag %s)\n", callid, fromtag ? fromtag : "<no fromtag>", totag ? totag : "<no totag>");
   18640             :         }
   18641             : 
   18642             :         /* Search dialogs and find the match */
   18643             : 
   18644           0 :         sip_pvt_ptr = ao2_t_find(dialogs, &tmp_dialog, OBJ_POINTER, "ao2_find of dialog in dialogs table");
   18645           0 :         if (sip_pvt_ptr) {
   18646             :                 /* Go ahead and lock it (and its owner) before returning */
   18647           0 :                 SCOPED_LOCK(lock, sip_pvt_ptr, sip_pvt_lock, sip_pvt_unlock);
   18648           0 :                 if (sip_cfg.pedanticsipchecking) {
   18649           0 :                         unsigned char frommismatch = 0, tomismatch = 0;
   18650             : 
   18651           0 :                         if (ast_strlen_zero(fromtag)) {
   18652           0 :                                 ast_debug(4, "Matched %s call for callid=%s - no from tag specified, pedantic check fails\n",
   18653             :                                           sip_pvt_ptr->outgoing_call == TRUE ? "OUTGOING": "INCOMING", sip_pvt_ptr->callid);
   18654           0 :                                 return -1;
   18655             :                         }
   18656             : 
   18657           0 :                         if (ast_strlen_zero(totag)) {
   18658           0 :                                 ast_debug(4, "Matched %s call for callid=%s - no to tag specified, pedantic check fails\n",
   18659             :                                           sip_pvt_ptr->outgoing_call == TRUE ? "OUTGOING": "INCOMING", sip_pvt_ptr->callid);
   18660           0 :                                 return -1;
   18661             :                         }
   18662             :                         /* RFC 3891
   18663             :                          * > 3.  User Agent Server Behavior: Receiving a Replaces Header
   18664             :                          * > The Replaces header contains information used to match an existing
   18665             :                          * > SIP dialog (call-id, to-tag, and from-tag).  Upon receiving an INVITE
   18666             :                          * > with a Replaces header, the User Agent (UA) attempts to match this
   18667             :                          * > information with a confirmed or early dialog.  The User Agent Server
   18668             :                          * > (UAS) matches the to-tag and from-tag parameters as if they were tags
   18669             :                          * > present in an incoming request.  In other words, the to-tag parameter
   18670             :                          * > is compared to the local tag, and the from-tag parameter is compared
   18671             :                          * > to the remote tag.
   18672             :                          *
   18673             :                          * Thus, the totag is always compared to the local tag, regardless if
   18674             :                          * this our call is an incoming or outgoing call.
   18675             :                          */
   18676           0 :                         frommismatch = !!strcmp(fromtag, sip_pvt_ptr->theirtag);
   18677           0 :                         tomismatch = !!strcmp(totag, sip_pvt_ptr->tag);
   18678             : 
   18679             :                         /* Don't check from if the dialog is not established, due to multi forking the from
   18680             :                          * can change when the call is not answered yet.
   18681             :                          */
   18682           0 :                         if ((frommismatch && ast_test_flag(&sip_pvt_ptr->flags[1], SIP_PAGE2_DIALOG_ESTABLISHED)) || tomismatch) {
   18683           0 :                                 if (frommismatch) {
   18684           0 :                                         ast_debug(4, "Matched %s call for callid=%s - pedantic from tag check fails; their tag is %s our tag is %s\n",
   18685             :                                                   sip_pvt_ptr->outgoing_call == TRUE ? "OUTGOING": "INCOMING", sip_pvt_ptr->callid,
   18686             :                                                   fromtag, sip_pvt_ptr->theirtag);
   18687             :                                 }
   18688           0 :                                 if (tomismatch) {
   18689           0 :                                         ast_debug(4, "Matched %s call for callid=%s - pedantic to tag check fails; their tag is %s our tag is %s\n",
   18690             :                                                   sip_pvt_ptr->outgoing_call == TRUE ? "OUTGOING": "INCOMING", sip_pvt_ptr->callid,
   18691             :                                                   totag, sip_pvt_ptr->tag);
   18692             :                                 }
   18693           0 :                                 return -1;
   18694             :                         }
   18695             :                 }
   18696             : 
   18697           0 :                 if (totag)
   18698           0 :                         ast_debug(4, "Matched %s call - their tag is %s Our tag is %s\n",
   18699             :                                           sip_pvt_ptr->outgoing_call == TRUE ? "OUTGOING": "INCOMING",
   18700             :                                           sip_pvt_ptr->theirtag, sip_pvt_ptr->tag);
   18701             : 
   18702           0 :                 *out_pvt = sip_pvt_ptr;

   18704           0 :                         *out_chan = sip_pvt_ptr->owner ? ast_channel_ref(sip_pvt_ptr->owner) : NULL;
   18705             :                 }
   18706             :         }
   18707             : 
   18708           0 :         if (!sip_pvt_ptr) {
   18709             :                 /* return error if sip_pvt was not found */
   18710           0 :                 return -1;
   18711             :         }
   18712             :

   18716           0 :         return 0;

   18719           0 : static void extract_transferrer_headers(const char *prefix, struct ast_channel *peer, const struct sip_request *req)

   18721           0 :         struct ast_str *pbxvar = ast_str_alloca(120);
   18722             :         int i;
   18723             : 
   18724             :         /* The '*' alone matches all headers. */
   18725           0 :         if (strcmp(prefix, "*") == 0) {
   18726           0 :                 prefix = "";
   18727             :         }
   18728             : 
   18729           0 :         for (i = 0; i < req->headers; i++) {
   18730           0 :                 const char *header = REQ_OFFSET_TO_STR(req, header[i]);

   18732           0 :                         int hdrlen = strcspn(header, " \t:");
