   19039             : /*! \brief Set the peers nat flags if they are using auto_* settings */
   19040         740 : static void set_peer_nat(const struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_peer *peer)
   19041             : {
   19042             : 
   19043         740 :         if (!p || !peer) {
   19044           0 :                 return;
   19045             :         }

   19063             : 
   19064             : /*! \brief Check and see if the requesting UA is likely to be behind a NAT.
   19065             :  *
   19066             :  * If the requesting NAT is behind NAT, set the * natdetected flag so that
   19067             :  * later, peers with nat=auto_* can use the value. Also, set the flags so
   19068             :  * that Asterisk responds identically whether or not a peer exists so as
   19069             :  * not to leak peer name information.
   19070             :  */
   19071        1705 : static void check_for_nat(const struct ast_sockaddr *addr, struct sip_pvt *p)
   19072             : {
   19073             :

   19082          22 :                 if (ast_test_flag(&p->flags[2], SIP_PAGE3_NAT_AUTO_RPORT)) {
   19083          22 :                         ast_set_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_NAT_FORCE_RPORT);

   19100             : /*! \brief check Via: header for hostname, port and rport request/answer */
   19101        1410 : static void check_via(struct sip_pvt *p, const struct sip_request *req)
   19102             : {
   19103             :         char via[512];
   19104             :         char *c, *maddr;
   19105        1410 :         struct ast_sockaddr tmp = { { 0, } };

   19108        1410 :         ast_copy_string(via, sip_get_header(req, "Via"), sizeof(via));

   19110             :         /* If this is via WebSocket we don't use the Via header contents at all */
   19111        1410 :         if (!strncasecmp(via, "SIP/2.0/WS", 10)) {
   19112           0 :                 return;
   19113             :         }
   19114             : 
   19115             :         /* Work on the leftmost value of the topmost Via header */
   19116        1410 :         c = strchr(via, ',');

   19118           0 :                 *c = '\0';
   19119             :

   19126             :

   19134             :         }
   19135             : 
   19136        1410 :         c = strchr(via, ';');
   19137        1410 :         if (c)
   19138        1410 :                 *c = '\0';

   19140        1410 :         c = strchr(via, ' ');

   20288             : /*! \brief Emit informations for one peer during sip show peers command */
   20289           0 : static struct sip_peer *_sip_show_peers_one(int fd, struct mansession *s, struct show_peers_context *cont, struct sip_peer *peer)
   20290             : {
   20291             :         /* _sip_show_peers_one() is separated from _sip_show_peers() to properly free the ast_strdupa
   20292             :          * (this is executed in a loop in _sip_show_peers() )
   20293             :          */
   20294             : 
   20295             :         char name[256];
   20296           0 :         char status[20] = "";
   20297             :         char pstatus;
   20298             : 
   20299             :         /*
   20300             :          * tmp_port and tmp_host store copies of ast_sockaddr_stringify strings since the
   20301             :          * string pointers for that function aren't valid between subsequent calls to
   20302             :          * ast_sockaddr_stringify functions
   20303             :          */
   20304             :         char *tmp_port;
   20305             :         char *tmp_host;
   20306             : 
   20307           0 :         tmp_port = ast_sockaddr_isnull(&peer->addr) ?
   20308           0 :                 "0" : ast_strdupa(ast_sockaddr_stringify_port(&peer->addr));
   20309             : 
   20310           0 :         tmp_host = ast_sockaddr_isnull(&peer->addr) ?
   20311           0 :                 "(Unspecified)" : ast_strdupa(ast_sockaddr_stringify_addr(&peer->addr));
   20312             : 
   20313           0 :         ao2_lock(peer);
   20314           0 :         if (cont->havepattern && regexec(&cont->regexbuf, peer->name, 0, NULL, 0)) {
   20315           0 :                 ao2_unlock(peer);
   20316           0 :                 return sip_unref_peer(peer, "toss iterator peer ptr no match");
   20317             :         }
   20318             : 
   20319           0 :         if (!ast_strlen_zero(peer->username) && !s) {
   20320           0 :                 snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "%s/%s", peer->name, peer->username);
   20321             :         } else {
   20322           0 :                 ast_copy_string(name, peer->name, sizeof(name));
   20323             :         }
   20324             : 
   20325           0 :         pstatus = peer_status(peer, status, sizeof(status));
   20326           0 :         if (pstatus == 1) {
   20327           0 :                 cont->peers_mon_online++;
   20328           0 :         } else if (pstatus == 0) {
   20329           0 :                 cont->peers_mon_offline++;
   20330             :         } else {
   20331           0 :                 if (ast_sockaddr_isnull(&peer->addr) ||
   20332           0 :                     !ast_sockaddr_port(&peer->addr)) {
   20333           0 :                         cont->peers_unmon_offline++;
   20334             :                 } else {
   20335           0 :                         cont->peers_unmon_online++;
   20336             :                 }
   20337             :         }
   20338             : 
   20339           0 :         if (!s) { /* Normal CLI list */
   20340           0 :                 ast_cli(fd, PEERS_FORMAT2, name,
   20341             :                 tmp_host,
   20342           0 :                 peer->host_dynamic ? " D " : "   ",      /* Dynamic or not? */

   20874           0 :                         snprintf(status, sizeof(status), "PeerStatus: Lagged\r\n");

   20877           0 :                         snprintf(status, sizeof(status), "PeerStatus: Reachable\r\n");

   22084             : /*! \brief CLI for show channels or subscriptions.

   22505             : /*! \brief  Receive SIP INFO Message */
   22506          52 : static void handle_request_info(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req)
   22507             : {
   22508          52 :         const char *buf = "";
   22509             :         unsigned int event;
   22510          52 :         const char *c = sip_get_header(req, "Content-Type");
   22511             : 
   22512             :         /* Need to check the media/type */
   22513          52 :         if (!strcasecmp(c, "application/dtmf-relay") ||
   22514          26 :             !strcasecmp(c, "application/vnd.nortelnetworks.digits") ||
   22515          26 :             !strcasecmp(c, "application/dtmf")) {
   22516          52 :                 unsigned int duration = 0;
   22517             : 
   22518          52 :                 if (!p->owner) {     /* not a PBX call */
   22519           0 :                         transmit_response(p, "481 Call leg/transaction does not exist", req);
   22520           0 :                         sip_scheddestroy(p, DEFAULT_TRANS_TIMEOUT);
   22521           0 :                         return;
   22522             :                 }
   22523             : 
   22524             :                 /* If dtmf-relay or vnd.nortelnetworks.digits, parse the signal and duration;
   22525             :                  * otherwise use the body as the signal */
   22526          52 :                 if (strcasecmp(c, "application/dtmf")) {
   22527             :                         const char *tmp;
   22528             : 
   22529          26 :                         if (ast_strlen_zero(buf = get_content_line(req, "Signal", '='))
   22530           1 :                                 && ast_strlen_zero(buf = get_content_line(req, "d", '='))) {
   22531           1 :                                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to retrieve DTMF signal for INFO message on "
   22532             :                                                 "call %s\n", p->callid);
   22533           1 :                                 transmit_response(p, "200 OK", req);
   22534           1 :                                 return;
   22535             :                         }
   22536          25 :                         if (!ast_strlen_zero((tmp = get_content_line(req, "Duration", '=')))) {
   22537          25 :                                 sscanf(tmp, "%30u", &duration);
   22538             :                         }
   22539             :                 } else {
   22540             :                         /* Type is application/dtmf, simply use what's in the message body */
   22541          26 :                         buf = get_content(req);
   22542             :                 }
   22543             : 
   22544             :                 /* An empty message body requires us to send a 200 OK */

   22929             : 
   22930             : /*! \brief  reply to authentication for outbound registrations
   22931             : \return Returns -1 if we have no auth
   22932             : \note   This is used for register= servers in sip.conf, SIP proxies we register
   22933             :         with  for receiving calls from.  */
   22934          16 : static int reply_digest(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req, char *header, int sipmethod,  char *digest, int digest_len)
   22935             : {
   22936             :         char tmp[512];
   22937             :         char *c;
   22938             :         char oldnonce[256];
   22939             : 
   22940             :         /* table of recognised keywords, and places where they should be copied */
   22941             :         const struct x {
   22942             :                 const char *key;
   22943             :                 const ast_string_field *field;
   22944          96 :         } *i, keys[] = {
   22945          16 :                 { "realm=", &p->realm },
   22946          16 :                 { "nonce=", &p->nonce },
   22947          16 :                 { "opaque=", &p->opaque },
   22948          16 :                 { "qop=", &p->qop },
   22949          16 :                 { "domain=", &p->domain },
   22950             :                 { NULL, 0 },
   22951             :         };
   22952             : 
   22953          16 :         ast_copy_string(tmp, sip_get_header(req, header), sizeof(tmp));
   22954          16 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(tmp))
   22955           0 :                 return -1;
   22956          16 :         if (strncasecmp(tmp, "Digest ", strlen("Digest "))) {
   22957           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "missing Digest.\n");
   22958           0 :                 return -1;
   22959             :         }
   22960          16 :         c = tmp + strlen("Digest ");
   22961          16 :         ast_copy_string(oldnonce, p->nonce, sizeof(oldnonce));
   22962          75 :         while (c && *(c = ast_skip_blanks(c))) {        /* lookup for keys */

   22964             :                         char *src, *separator;
   22965         192 :                         if (strncasecmp(c, i->key, strlen(i->key)) != 0)

   22969          30 :                         if (*c == '"') {
   22970          30 :                                 src = ++c;
   22971          30 :                                 separator = "\"";

   22973           0 :                                 src = c;
   22974           0 :                                 separator = ",";

   23596             : /*!
   23597             :  * \brief Check pending actions on SIP call
   23598             :  *
   23599             :  * \note both sip_pvt and sip_pvt's owner channel (if present)
   23600             :  *  must be locked for this function.
   23601             :  *
   23602             :  * \note Run by the sched thread.
   23603             :  */
   23604        1398 : static void check_pendings(struct sip_pvt *p)
   23605             : {
   23606        1398 :         if (ast_test_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_PENDINGBYE)) {
   23607          48 :                 if (p->reinviteid > -1) {
   23608             :                         /* Outstanding p->reinviteid timeout, so wait... */
   23609          17 :                         return;
   23610             :                 }
   23611          31 :                 if (p->invitestate == INV_PROCEEDING || p->invitestate == INV_EARLY_MEDIA) {
   23612             :                         /* if we can't BYE, then this is really a pending CANCEL */

   23615             :                         /* If the cancel occurred on an initial invite, cancel the pending BYE */

   23617           0 :                                 ast_clear_flag(&p->flags[0], SIP_PENDINGBYE | SIP_NEEDREINVITE);
   23618             :                         }
   23619             :                         /* Actually don't destroy us yet, wait for the 487 on our original
   23620             :                            INVITE, but do set an autodestruct just in case we never get it. */
   23621             :                 } else {
   23622             :                         /* We have a pending outbound invite, don't send something
   23623             :                          * new in-transaction, unless it is a pending reinvite, then
   23624             :                          * by the time we are called here, we should probably just hang up. */

   23680             : /*!

   23682             :  * to avoid race conditions between asterisk servers.
   23683             :  *
   23684             :  * \note Run by the sched thread.

   23688           0 :         struct sip_pvt *p = (struct sip_pvt *) data;
   23689             :         struct ast_channel *owner;
   23690             : 
   23691           0 :         owner = sip_pvt_lock_full(p);

   23694           0 :         check_pendings(p);
   23695           0 :         sip_pvt_unlock(p);
   23696           0 :         if (owner) {
   23697           0 :                 ast_channel_unlock(owner);
   23698           0 :                 ast_channel_unref(owner);
   23699             :         }
   23700           0 :         dialog_unref(p, "Schedule waitid complete");
   23701           0 :         return 0;
   23702             : }

   23764             :          * PUBLISH, and REGISTER could all benefit from the same shared code.

   23789           0 : static void handle_response_publish(struct sip_pvt *p, int resp, const char *rest, struct sip_request *req, uint32_t seqno)

   23800             :                 }

   23804           0 :                         sip_alreadygone(p);
   23805             :                 }
   23806           0 :                 return;
   23807             :         }
   23808             : 
   23809           0 :         if (resp == 501 || resp == 405) {
   23810           0 :                 mark_method_unallowed(&p->allowed_methods, SIP_PUBLISH);
   23811             :         }
   23812             : 
   23813           0 :         if (resp == 200) {
   23814           0 :                 p->authtries = 0;
   23815             :                 /* If I've read section 6, item 6 of RFC 3903 correctly,
   23816             :                  * an ESC will only generate a new etag when it sends a 200 OK
   23817             :                  */
   23818           0 :                 if (!ast_strlen_zero(etag)) {
   23819           0 :                         ast_copy_string(epa_entry->entity_tag, etag, sizeof(epa_entry->entity_tag));
   23820             :                 }

   23822             :                  * Each EPA will have a specific action to take as a result of this
   23823             :                  * development, so ... callbacks!
   23824             :                  */
   23825           0 :                 if (epa_entry->static_data->handle_ok) {
   23826           0 :                         epa_entry->static_data->handle_ok(p, req, epa_entry);
   23827             :                 }
   23828             :         } else {

   23830             :                  * type, there is just a single error callback. The callback
   23831             :                  * can distinguish between error messages and do what it needs to

   24572             : /* \brief Handle SIP response in REFER transaction

   24645           0 :                 break;
   24646           0 :         case 603:   /* Transfer declined */

   24648           0 :                 p->refer->status = REFER_FAILED;

   24653           0 :                 break;

   24655             :                 /* We should treat unrecognized 9xx as 900.  400 is actually
   24656             :                    specified as a possible response, but any 4-6xx is
   24657             :                    theoretically possible. */
   24658             :

   24662           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SIP transfer to %s with response (%d). \n", p->refer->refer_to, resp);

   25037             : /*! \brief Handle SIP response in dialogue
   25038             :         \note only called by handle_incoming */
   25039        1233 : static void handle_response(struct sip_pvt *p, int resp, const char *rest, struct sip_request *req, uint32_t seqno)
   25040             : {
   25041             :         struct ast_channel *owner;
   25042             :         int sipmethod;
   25043        1233 :         const char *c = sip_get_header(req, "Cseq");
   25044             :         /* GCC 4.2 complains if I try to cast c as a char * when passing it to ast_skip_nonblanks, so make a copy of it */
   25045        1233 :         char *c_copy = ast_strdupa(c);
   25046             :         /* Skip the Cseq and its subsequent spaces */
   25047        1233 :         const char *msg = ast_skip_blanks(ast_skip_nonblanks(c_copy));
   25048        1233 :         int ack_res = FALSE;
   25049             : 
   25050        1233 :         if (!msg)
   25051           0 :                 msg = "";
   25052             : 
   25053        1233 :         sipmethod = find_sip_method(msg);
   25054        1233 :         owner = p->owner;
   25055        1233 :         if (owner) {
   25056         848 :                 ast_channel_hangupcause_set(owner, 0);
   25057         848 :                 if (use_reason_header(p, req)) {
   25058             :                         /* Use the SIP cause */
   25059         848 :                         ast_channel_hangupcause_set(owner, hangup_sip2cause(resp));
   25060             :                 }
   25061             :         }
   25062             : 
   25063             :         /* Acknowledge whatever it is destined for */
   25064        1233 :         if ((resp >= 100) && (resp <= 199)) {
   25065             :                 /* NON-INVITE messages do not ack a 1XX response. RFC 3261 section 17.1.2.2 */
   25066         830 :                 if (sipmethod == SIP_INVITE) {
   25067         415 :                         ack_res = __sip_semi_ack(p, seqno, 0, sipmethod);
   25068             :                 }
   25069             :         } else {
   25070         818 :                 ack_res = __sip_ack(p, seqno, 0, sipmethod);
   25071             :         }
   25072             : 
   25073        1233 :         if (ack_res == FALSE) {
   25074             :                 /* RFC 3261 13.2.2.4 and 17.1.1.2 - We must re-send ACKs to re-transmitted final responses */
   25075           9 :                 if (sipmethod == SIP_INVITE && resp >= 200) {
   25076           1 :                         transmit_request(p, SIP_ACK, seqno, XMIT_UNRELIABLE, resp < 300 ? TRUE: FALSE);
   25077             :                 }
   25078             : 
   25079           9 :                 append_history(p, "Ignore", "Ignoring this retransmit\n");
   25080           9 :                 return;
   25081             :         }
   25082             :

   25107             :         /* RFC 3261 Section 15 specifies that if we receive a 408 or 481
   25108             :          * in response to a BYE, then we should end the current dialog
   25109             :          * and session.  It is known that at least one phone manufacturer
   25110             :          * potentially will send a 404 in response to a BYE, so we'll be
   25111             :          * liberal in what we accept and end the dialog and session if we
   25112             :          * receive any of those responses to a BYE.

   25649             :                 NOTIFY containing either the body:
   25650             :                         SIP/2.0 100 Trying
   25651             : 
   25652             :                 if the subscription is pending, the body:
   25653             :                         SIP/2.0 200 OK
   25654             :                 if the reference was successful, the body:
   25655             :                         SIP/2.0 503 Service Unavailable
   25656             :                 if the reference failed, or the body:
   25657             :                         SIP/2.0 603 Declined
   25658             : 
   25659             :                 if the REFER request was accepted before approval to follow the
   25660             :                 reference could be obtained and that approval was subsequently denied
   25661             :                 (see Section 2.4.7).
   25662             : 
   25663             :                 If there are several REFERs in the same dialog, we need to

   25835             : /*! \brief Handle the transfer part of INVITE with a replaces: header,
   25836             :  *
   25837             :  * This is used for call-pickup and for attended transfers initiated on
   25838             :  * remote endpoints (i.e. a REFER received on a remote server).
   25839             :  *
   25840             :  * \note p and p->owner are locked upon entering this function. If the
   25841             :  * call pickup or attended transfer is successful, then p->owner will
   25842             :  * be unlocked upon exiting this function. This is communicated to the
   25843             :  * caller through the nounlock parameter.
   25844             :  *
   25845             :  * \param p The sip_pvt where the INVITE with Replaces was received
   25846             :  * \param req The incoming INVITE
   25847             :  * \param[out] nounlock Indicator if p->owner should remained locked. On successful transfer, this will be set true.

   25849             :  * \param replaces_chan replaces_pvt's owner channel
   25850             :  * \retval 0 Success
   25851             :  * \retval non-zero Failure
   25852             :  */

   25932             : 
   25933             : /*!
   25934             :  * \brief Called to deny a T38 reinvite if the core does not respond to our request
   25935             :  *
   25936             :  * \note Run by the sched thread.
   25937             :  */
   25938           0 : static int sip_t38_abort(const void *data)
   25939             : {
   25940           0 :         struct sip_pvt *pvt = (struct sip_pvt *) data;
   25941             :         struct ast_channel *owner;
   25942             : 
   25943           0 :         owner = sip_pvt_lock_full(pvt);
   25944           0 :         pvt->t38id = -1;
   25945             : 
   25946             :         /*
   25947             :          * An application may have taken ownership of the T.38 negotiation

   26016             : /*!

   26203             : /*!
   26204             :  * \brief Handle incoming INVITE request
   26205             :  * \note If the INVITE has a Replaces header, it is part of an

   26325             :                         /* What do these circumstances mean? We have received an INVITE for an "incoming" dialog for which we
   26326             :                          * have sent a final response. We have not yet received an ACK, though (which is why p->pendinginvite is non-zero).
   26327             :                          * We also know that the INVITE is not a retransmission, because otherwise the "ignore" flag would be set.
   26328             :                          * This means that either we are receiving a reinvite for a terminated dialog, or we are receiving an INVITE with
   26329             :                          * credentials based on one we challenged earlier.
   26330             :                          *
   26331             :                          * The action to take in either case is to treat the INVITE as though it contains an implicit ACK for the previous
   26332             :                          * transaction. Calling __sip_ack will take care of this by clearing the p->pendinginvite and removing the response
   26333             :                          * from the previous transaction from the list of outstanding packets.

   26766         506 :         if (c && replace_id) {  /* Attended transfer or call pickup - we're the target */
   26767           0 :                 if (!ast_strlen_zero(pickup.exten)) {
   26768           0 :                         append_history(p, "Xfer", "INVITE/Replace received");
   26769             : 
   26770             :                         /* Let the caller know we're giving it a shot */
   26771           0 :                         transmit_response(p, "100 Trying", req);
   26772           0 :                         p->invitestate = INV_PROCEEDING;
   26773           0 :                         ast_setstate(c, AST_STATE_RING);
   26774             : 
   26775             :                         /* Do the pickup itself */
   26776           0 :                         ast_channel_unlock(c);
   26777           0 :                         *nounlock = 1;
   26778             : 
   26779             :                         /* since p->owner (c) is unlocked, we need to go ahead and unlock pvt for both
   26780             :                          * magic pickup and ast_hangup.  Both of these functions will attempt to lock
   26781             :                          * p->owner again, which can cause a deadlock if we already hold a lock on p.
   26782             :                          * Locking order is, channel then pvt.  Dead lock avoidance must be used if
   26783             :                          * called the other way around. */
   26784           0 :                         sip_pvt_unlock(p);

   26786             :                         /* Now we're either masqueraded or we failed to pickup, in either case we... */
   26787           0 :                         ast_hangup(c);
   26788           0 :                         sip_pvt_lock(p); /* pvt is expected to remain locked on return, so re-lock it */
   26789             : 
   26790           0 :                         res = INV_REQ_FAILED;
   26791           0 :                         goto request_invite_cleanup;

   26793             :                         /* Go and take over the target call */

   26817             :                          * state, then this likely means that we have a situation where the initial
   26818             :                          * INVITE transaction has completed *but* the channel's state has not yet been
   26819             :                          * changed to UP. The reason this could happen is if the reinvite is received

   26948             : 
   26949             : /*! \brief Check for the presence of OLI tag(s) in the From header and set on the channel
   26950             :  */
   26951         506 : static void parse_oli(struct sip_request *req, struct ast_channel *chan)
   26952             : {
   26953         506 :         const char *from = NULL;
   26954         506 :         const char *s = NULL;
   26955         506 :         int ani2 = 0;
   26956             : 
   26957         506 :         if (!chan || !req) {
   26958             :                 /* null pointers are not helpful */
   26959           5 :                 return;
   26960             :         }
   26961             : 
   26962         501 :         from = sip_get_header(req, "From");
   26963         501 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(from)) {
   26964             :                 /* no From header */
   26965           0 :                 return;
   26966             :         }
   26967             : 
   26968             :         /* Look for the possible OLI tags. */
   26969         501 :         if ((s = strcasestr(from, ";isup-oli="))) {
   26970           0 :                 s += 10;
   26971         501 :         } else if ((s = strcasestr(from, ";ss7-oli="))) {
   26972           0 :                 s += 9;
   26973         501 :         } else if ((s = strcasestr(from, ";oli="))) {
   26974           0 :                 s += 5;
   26975             :         }
   26976             : 
   26977         501 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(s)) {
   26978             :                 /* OLI tag is missing, or present with nothing following the '=' sign */
   26979         501 :                 return;
   26980             :         }
   26981             : 
   26982             :         /* just in case OLI is quoted */
   26983           0 :         if (*s == '\"') {
   26984           0 :                 s++;
   26985             :         }
   26986             : 
   26987           0 :         if (sscanf(s, "%d", &ani2)) {
   26988           0 :                 ast_channel_caller(chan)->ani2 = ani2;
   26989             :         }
   26990             : 
   26991           0 :         return;
   26992             : }
   26993             : 
   26994             : /*! \brief  Find all call legs and bridge transferee with target
   26995             :  *      called from handle_request_refer
   26996             :  *
   26997             :  *      \note this function assumes two locks to begin with, sip_pvt transferer and current.chan1 (the pvt's owner)...
   26998             :  *      2 additional locks are held at the beginning of the function, targetcall_pvt, and targetcall_pvt's owner
   26999             :  *      channel (which is stored in target.chan1).  These 2 locks _MUST_ be let go by the end of the function.  Do
   27000             :  *      not be confused into thinking a pvt's owner is the same thing as the channels locked at the beginning of
   27001             :  *      this function, after the masquerade this may not be true.  Be consistent and unlock only the exact same
   27002             :  *      pointers that were locked to begin with.
   27003             :  *
   27004             :  *      If this function is successful, only the transferer pvt lock will remain on return.  Setting nounlock indicates
   27005             :  *      to handle_request_do() that the pvt's owner it locked does not require an unlock.
   27006             :  */
   27007           0 : static int local_attended_transfer(struct sip_pvt *transferer, struct ast_channel *transferer_chan, uint32_t seqno, int *nounlock)
   27008             : {
   27009           0 :         RAII_VAR(struct sip_pvt *, targetcall_pvt, NULL, ao2_cleanup);
   27010           0 :         RAII_VAR(struct ast_channel *, targetcall_chan, NULL, ao2_cleanup);
   27011             :         enum ast_transfer_result transfer_res;
   27012             : 
   27013             :         /* Check if the call ID of the replaces header does exist locally */
   27014           0 :         if (get_sip_pvt_from_replaces(transferer->refer->replaces_callid,
   27015           0 :                                 transferer->refer->replaces_callid_totag,
   27016           0 :                                 transferer->refer->replaces_callid_fromtag,
   27017             :                                 &targetcall_pvt, &targetcall_chan)) {
   27018           0 :                 if (transferer->refer->localtransfer) {
   27019             :                         /* We did not find the refered call. Sorry, can't accept then */
   27020             :                         /* Let's fake a response from someone else in order
   27021             :                         to follow the standard */
   27022           0 :                         transmit_notify_with_sipfrag(transferer, seqno, "481 Call leg/transaction does not exist", TRUE);
   27023           0 :                         append_history(transferer, "Xfer", "Refer failed");
   27024           0 :                         ast_clear_flag(&transferer->flags[0], SIP_GOTREFER);
   27025           0 :                         transferer->refer->status = REFER_FAILED;
   27026           0 :                         return -1;
   27027             :                 }
   27028             :                 /* Fall through for remote transfers that we did not find locally */
   27029           0 :                 ast_debug(3, "SIP attended transfer: Not our call - generating INVITE with replaces\n");
   27030           0 :                 return 0;
   27031             :         }
   27032             : 
   27033           0 :         if (!targetcall_chan) { /* No active channel */
   27034           0 :                 ast_debug(4, "SIP attended transfer: Error: No owner of target call\n");
   27035             :                 /* Cancel transfer */
   27036           0 :                 transmit_notify_with_sipfrag(transferer, seqno, "503 Service Unavailable", TRUE);
   27037           0 :                 append_history(transferer, "Xfer", "Refer failed");
   27038           0 :                 ast_clear_flag(&transferer->flags[0], SIP_GOTREFER);
   27039           0 :                 transferer->refer->status = REFER_FAILED;
   27040           0 :                 return -1;
   27041             :         }
   27042             : 
   27043           0 :         ast_set_flag(&transferer->flags[0], SIP_DEFER_BYE_ON_TRANSFER);  /* Delay hangup */
   27044             : 
   27045           0 :         sip_pvt_unlock(transferer);
   27046           0 :         ast_channel_unlock(transferer_chan);
   27047           0 :         *nounlock = 1;
   27048             : 
   27049           0 :         transfer_res = ast_bridge_transfer_attended(transferer_chan, targetcall_chan);
   27050             : 
   27051           0 :         sip_pvt_lock(transferer);
   27052             : 
   27053           0 :         switch (transfer_res) {
   27054           0 :         case AST_BRIDGE_TRANSFER_SUCCESS:
   27055           0 :                 transferer->refer->status = REFER_200OK;
   27056           0 :                 transmit_notify_with_sipfrag(transferer, seqno, "200 OK", TRUE);
   27057           0 :                 append_history(transferer, "Xfer", "Refer succeeded");
   27058           0 :                 return 1;
   27059           0 :         case AST_BRIDGE_TRANSFER_FAIL:
   27060           0 :                 transferer->refer->status = REFER_FAILED;
   27061           0 :                 transmit_notify_with_sipfrag(transferer, seqno, "500 Internal Server Error", TRUE);
   27062           0 :                 append_history(transferer, "Xfer", "Refer failed (internal error)");
   27063           0 :                 ast_clear_flag(&transferer->flags[0], SIP_DEFER_BYE_ON_TRANSFER);
   27064           0 :                 return -1;
   27065           0 :         case AST_BRIDGE_TRANSFER_INVALID:
   27066           0 :                 transferer->refer->status = REFER_FAILED;
   27067           0 :                 transmit_notify_with_sipfrag(transferer, seqno, "503 Service Unavailable", TRUE);
   27068           0 :                 append_history(transferer, "Xfer", "Refer failed (invalid bridge state)");
   27069           0 :                 ast_clear_flag(&transferer->flags[0], SIP_DEFER_BYE_ON_TRANSFER);
   27070           0 :                 return -1;
   27071           0 :         case AST_BRIDGE_TRANSFER_NOT_PERMITTED:
   27072           0 :                 transferer->refer->status = REFER_FAILED;
   27073           0 :                 transmit_notify_with_sipfrag(transferer, seqno, "403 Forbidden", TRUE);
   27074           0 :                 append_history(transferer, "Xfer", "Refer failed (operation not permitted)");
   27075           0 :                 ast_clear_flag(&transferer->flags[0], SIP_DEFER_BYE_ON_TRANSFER);
   27076           0 :                 return -1;
   27077           0 :         default:
   27078           0 :                 break;
   27079             :         }
   27080             : 
   27081           0 :         return 1;
   27082             : }
   27083             : 
   27084             : /*!
   27085             :  * Data to set on a channel that runs dialplan
   27086             :  * at the completion of a blind transfer
   27087             :  */
   27088             : struct blind_transfer_cb_data {
   27089             :         /*! Contents of the REFER's Referred-by header */
   27090             :         const char *referred_by;
   27091             :         /*! Domain of the URI in the REFER's Refer-To header */
   27092             :         const char *domain;
   27093             :         /*! Contents of what to place in a Replaces header of an INVITE */
   27094             :         const char *replaces;
   27095             :         /*! Redirecting information to set on the channel */
   27096             :         struct ast_party_redirecting redirecting;
   27097             :         /*! Parts of the redirecting structure that are to be updated */
   27098             :         struct ast_set_party_redirecting update_redirecting;
   27099             : };
   27100             : 
   27101             : /*!
   27102             :  * \internal
   27103             :  * \brief Callback called on new outbound channel during blind transfer
   27104             :  *
   27105             :  * We use this opportunity to populate the channel with data from the REFER
   27106             :  * so that, if necessary, we can include proper information on any new INVITE
   27107             :  * we may send out.
   27108             :  *
   27109             :  * \param chan The new outbound channel
   27110             :  * \param user_data A blind_transfer_cb_data struct
   27111             :  * \param transfer_type Unused
   27112             :  */
   27113           5 : static void blind_transfer_cb(struct ast_channel *chan, struct transfer_channel_data *user_data_wrapper,
   27114             :                 enum ast_transfer_type transfer_type)
   27115             : {
   27116           5 :         struct blind_transfer_cb_data *cb_data = user_data_wrapper->data;
   27117             : 
   27118           5 :         pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(chan, "SIPTRANSFER", "yes");
   27119           5 :         pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(chan, "SIPTRANSFER_REFERER", cb_data->referred_by);
   27120           5 :         pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(chan, "SIPTRANSFER_REPLACES", cb_data->replaces);
   27121           5 :         pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(chan, "SIPDOMAIN", cb_data->domain);
   27122           5 :         ast_channel_update_redirecting(chan, &cb_data->redirecting, &cb_data->update_redirecting);
   27123           5 : }
   27124             : 
   27125             : /*! \brief Handle incoming REFER request */
   27126             : /*! \page SIP_REFER SIP transfer Support (REFER)
   27127             : 
   27128             :         REFER is used for call transfer in SIP. We get a REFER
   27129             :         to place a new call with an INVITE somwhere and then
   27130             :         keep the transferor up-to-date of the transfer. If the
   27131             :         transfer fails, get back on line with the orginal call.
   27132             : 
   27133             :         - REFER can be sent outside or inside of a dialog.
   27134             :           Asterisk only accepts REFER inside of a dialog.
   27135             : 
   27136             :         - If we get a replaces header, it is an attended transfer
   27137             : 
   27138             :         \par Blind transfers
   27139             :         The transferor provides the transferee
   27140             :         with the transfer targets contact. The signalling between
   27141             :         transferer or transferee should not be cancelled, so the
   27142             :         call is recoverable if the transfer target can not be reached
   27143             :         by the transferee.
   27144             : 
   27145             :         In this case, Asterisk receives a TRANSFER from
   27146             :         the transferor, thus is the transferee. We should
   27147             :         try to set up a call to the contact provided
   27148             :         and if that fails, re-connect the current session.
   27149             :         If the new call is set up, we issue a hangup.
   27150             :         In this scenario, we are following section 5.2
   27151             :         in the SIP CC Transfer draft. (Transfer without
   27152             :         a GRUU)
   27153             : 
   27154             :         \par Transfer with consultation hold
   27155             :         In this case, the transferor
   27156             :         talks to the transfer target before the transfer takes place.
   27157             :         This is implemented with SIP hold and transfer.
   27158             :         Note: The invite From: string could indicate a transfer.
   27159             :         (Section 6. Transfer with consultation hold)
   27160             :         The transferor places the transferee on hold, starts a call
   27161             :         with the transfer target to alert them to the impending
   27162             :         transfer, terminates the connection with the target, then
   27163             :         proceeds with the transfer (as in Blind transfer above)
   27164             : 
   27165             :         \par Attended transfer
   27166             :         The transferor places the transferee
   27167             :         on hold, calls the transfer target to alert them,
   27168             :         places the target on hold, then proceeds with the transfer
   27169             :         using a Replaces header field in the Refer-to header. This
   27170             :         will force the transfee to send an Invite to the target,
   27171             :         with a replaces header that instructs the target to
   27172             :         hangup the call between the transferor and the target.
   27173             :         In this case, the Refer/to: uses the AOR address. (The same
   27174             :         URI that the transferee used to establish the session with
   27175             :         the transfer target (To: ). The Require: replaces header should
   27176             :         be in the INVITE to avoid the wrong UA in a forked SIP proxy
   27177             :         scenario to answer and have no call to replace with.
   27178             : 
   27179             :         The referred-by header is *NOT* required, but if we get it,
   27180             :         can be copied into the INVITE to the transfer target to
   27181             :         inform the target about the transferor
   27182             : 
   27183             :         "Any REFER request has to be appropriately authenticated.".
   27184             : 
   27185             :         We can't destroy dialogs, since we want the call to continue.
   27186             : 
   27187             :         */

   27402           5 : static int handle_request_cancel(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req)
   27403             : {
   27404             :

   27418             :            as the other side sends a CANCEL. Our final reply with error code
   27419             :            might not have been received by the other side before the CANCEL

   27421             :            ACK on our error code. The call is hanging up any way. */

   27440             :                  * a reliable 487, then we don't want to schedule another one on top of the previous
   27441             :                  * one.
   27442             :                  *
   27443             :                  * As odd as this may sound, we can't rely on the previously-transmitted "reliable"
   27444             :                  * response in this situation. What if we've sent all of our reliable responses
   27445             :                  * already and now all of a sudden, we get this second CANCEL?
   27446             :                  *
   27447             :                  * The only way to do this correctly is to cancel our previously-scheduled reliably-
   27448             :                  * transmitted response and send a new one in its place.
   27449             :                  */

   27877           0 : static enum sip_publish_type determine_sip_publish_type(struct sip_request *req, const char * const event, const char * const etag, const char * const expires, int *expires_int)

   27879           0 :         int etag_present = !ast_strlen_zero(etag);
   27880           0 :         int body_present = req->lines > 0;
   27881             : 
   27882           0 :         ast_assert(expires_int != NULL);
   27883             : 
   27884           0 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(expires)) {
   27885             :                 /* Section 6, item 4, second bullet point of RFC 3903 says to
   27886             :                  * use a locally-configured default expiration if none is provided
   27887             :                  * in the request
   27888             :                  */
   27889           0 :                 *expires_int = DEFAULT_PUBLISH_EXPIRES;
   27890           0 :         } else if (sscanf(expires, "%30d", expires_int) != 1) {
   27891           0 :                 return SIP_PUBLISH_UNKNOWN;
   27892             :         }
   27893             : 
   27894           0 :         if (*expires_int == 0) {
   27895           0 :                 return SIP_PUBLISH_REMOVE;
   27896           0 :         } else if (!etag_present && body_present) {
   27897           0 :                 return SIP_PUBLISH_INITIAL;
   27898           0 :         } else if (etag_present && !body_present) {
   27899           0 :                 return SIP_PUBLISH_REFRESH;
   27900           0 :         } else if (etag_present && body_present) {
   27901           0 :                 return SIP_PUBLISH_MODIFY;
   27902             :         }
   27903             : 
   27904           0 :         return SIP_PUBLISH_UNKNOWN;
   27905             : }

   27907             : #ifdef HAVE_LIBXML2
   27908           0 : static int pidf_validate_tuple(struct ast_xml_node *tuple_node)

   27918             :         }
   27919             :         /* We don't care what it actually is, just that it's there */
   27920           0 :         ast_xml_free_attr(id);

   27923             :                 /* The tuple has no children. It sucks */

   27928           0 :                         tuple_children_iterator = ast_xml_node_get_next(tuple_children_iterator)) {

   27931             :                  * position. We will enforce that only a single status element can be present.
   27932             :                  */

   27934             :                         /* Not the status, we don't care */
   27935           0 :                         continue;

   27943             :         }

   27946             : 
   27947             : 
   27948           0 : static int pidf_validate_presence(struct ast_xml_doc *doc)
   27949             : {
   27950           0 :         struct ast_xml_node *presence_node = ast_xml_get_root(doc);
   27951             :         struct ast_xml_node *child_nodes;
   27952             :         struct ast_xml_node *node_iterator;
   27953             :         struct ast_xml_ns *ns;
   27954             :         const char *entity;
   27955             :         const char *namespace;
   27956           0 :         const char presence_namespace[] = "urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:pidf";
   27957             : 
   27958           0 :         if (!presence_node) {
   27959           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to retrieve root node of the XML document\n");
   27960           0 :                 return FALSE;
   27961             :         }
   27962             :         /* Okay, we managed to open the document! YAY! Now, let's start making sure it's all PIDF-ified
   27963             :          * correctly.
   27964             :          */
   27965           0 :         if (strcmp(ast_xml_node_get_name(presence_node), "presence")) {
   27966           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Root node of PIDF document is not 'presence'. Invalid\n");
   27967           0 :                 return FALSE;
   27968             :         }
   27969             : 
   27970             :         /* The presence element must have an entity attribute and an xmlns attribute. Furthermore
   27971             :          * the xmlns attribute must be "urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:pidf"
   27972             :          */
   27973           0 :         if (!(entity = ast_xml_get_attribute(presence_node, "entity"))) {
   27974           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Presence element of PIDF document has no 'entity' attribute\n");
   27975           0 :                 return FALSE;
   27976             :         }
   27977             :         /* We're not interested in what the entity is, just that it exists */
   27978           0 :         ast_xml_free_attr(entity);
   27979             : 
   27980           0 :         if (!(ns = ast_xml_find_namespace(doc, presence_node, NULL))) {
   27981           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Couldn't find default namespace...\n");
   27982           0 :                 return FALSE;
   27983             :         }
   27984             : 
   27985           0 :         namespace = ast_xml_get_ns_href(ns);
   27986           0 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(namespace) || strcmp(namespace, presence_namespace)) {
   27987           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "PIDF document has invalid namespace value %s\n", namespace);
   27988           0 :                 return FALSE;
   27989             :         }
   27990             : 
   27991           0 :         if (!(child_nodes = ast_xml_node_get_children(presence_node))) {
   27992           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "PIDF document has no elements as children of 'presence'. Invalid\n");
   27993           0 :                 return FALSE;
   27994             :         }
   27995             : 
   27996             :         /* Check for tuple elements. RFC 3863 says that PIDF documents can have any number of
   27997             :          * tuples, including 0. The big thing here is that if there are tuple elements present,
   27998             :          * they have to have a single status element within.
   27999             :          *
   28000             :          * The RFC is worded such that tuples should appear as the first elements as children of
   28001             :          * the presence element. However, we'll be accepting of documents which may place other elements
   28002             :          * before the tuple(s).
   28003             :          */
   28004           0 :         for (node_iterator = child_nodes; node_iterator;
   28005           0 :                         node_iterator = ast_xml_node_get_next(node_iterator)) {
   28006           0 :                 if (strcmp(ast_xml_node_get_name(node_iterator), "tuple")) {
   28007             :                         /* Not a tuple. We don't give a rat's hind quarters */
   28008           0 :                         continue;
   28009             :                 }
   28010           0 :                 if (pidf_validate_tuple(node_iterator) == FALSE) {
   28011           0 :                         ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to validate tuple\n");
   28012           0 :                         return FALSE;
   28013             :                 }
   28014             :         }
   28015             : 
   28016           0 :         return TRUE;
   28017             : }
   28018             : 
   28019             : /*!
   28020             :  * \brief Makes sure that body is properly formatted PIDF
   28021             :  *
   28022             :  * Specifically, we check that the document has a "presence" element
   28023             :  * at the root and that within that, there is at least one "tuple" element
   28024             :  * that contains a "status" element.
   28025             :  *
   28026             :  * XXX This function currently assumes a default namespace is used. Of course
   28027             :  * if you're not using a default namespace, you're probably a stupid jerk anyway.
   28028             :  *
   28029             :  * \param req The SIP request to check
   28030             :  * \param[out] pidf_doc The validated PIDF doc.
   28031             :  * \retval FALSE The XML was malformed or the basic PIDF structure was marred
   28032             :  * \retval TRUE The PIDF document is of a valid format
   28033             :  */
   28034           0 : static int sip_pidf_validate(struct sip_request *req, struct ast_xml_doc **pidf_doc)
   28035             : {
   28036             :         struct ast_xml_doc *doc;
   28037           0 :         const char *content_type = sip_get_header(req, "Content-Type");

   28274           0 : static int handle_request_publish(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req, struct ast_sockaddr *addr, const uint32_t seqno, const char *uri)

   28294           0 :                 return -1;
   28295             :         }
   28296             : 
   28297           0 :         auth_result = check_user(p, req, SIP_PUBLISH, uri, XMIT_UNRELIABLE, addr);
   28298           0 :         if (auth_result == AUTH_CHALLENGE_SENT) {

   28300           0 :                 return 0;
   28301           0 :         } else if (auth_result < 0) {
   28302           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Failed to authenticate device %s\n", sip_get_header(req, "From"));

   28320             :         }
   28321           0 :         p->expiry = expires_int;

   28329           0 :                 break;

   28332           0 :                 break;

   28338           0 :                 break;

   28341           0 :                 break;

   28344           0 :                 break;
   28345             :         }

   28354             : 
   28355             : /*!
   28356             :  * \internal
   28357             :  * \brief Subscribe to MWI events for the specified peer
   28358             :  *
   28359             :  * \note The peer cannot be locked during this method.  sip_send_mwi_peer will
   28360             :  * attempt to lock the peer after the event subscription lock is held; if the peer is locked during
   28361             :  * this method then we will attempt to lock the event subscription lock but after the peer, creating
   28362             :  * a locking inversion.
   28363             :  */

   28372           0 :                         continue;
   28373             :                 }

   28382           0 : static int handle_cc_subscribe(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req)

   28432             : 
   28433             :         /* We don't send a response here. That is done in the agent's ack callback or in the

   28435             :          */
   28436           0 :         ao2_ref(agent, -1);
   28437           0 :         return 0;
   28438             : }
   28439             : 
   28440             : /*! \brief  Handle incoming SUBSCRIBE request */
   28441          18 : static int handle_request_subscribe(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req, struct ast_sockaddr *addr, uint32_t seqno, const char *e)
   28442             : {
   28443          18 :         int res = 0;
   28444          18 :         struct sip_peer *authpeer = NULL;
   28445          18 :         char *event = ast_strdupa(sip_get_header(req, "Event")); /* Get Event package name */
   28446          18 :         int resubscribe = (p->subscribed != NONE) && !req->ignore;
   28447             :         char *options;
   28448             : 
   28449          18 :         if (p->initreq.headers) {
   28450             :                 /* We already have a dialog */
   28451           8 :                 if (p->initreq.method != SIP_SUBSCRIBE) {
   28452             :                         /* This is a SUBSCRIBE within another SIP dialog, which we do not support */
   28453             :                         /* For transfers, this could happen, but since we haven't seen it happening, let us just refuse this */
   28454           0 :                         transmit_response(p, "403 Forbidden (within dialog)", req);
   28455             :                         /* Do not destroy session, since we will break the call if we do */
   28456           0 :                         ast_debug(1, "Got a subscription within the context of another call, can't handle that - %s (Method %s)\n", p->callid, sip_methods[p->initreq.method].text);
   28457           0 :                         return 0;
   28458           8 :                 } else if (req->debug) {
   28459           8 :                         if (resubscribe)
   28460           6 :                                 ast_debug(1, "Got a re-subscribe on existing subscription %s\n", p->callid);
   28461             :                         else
   28462           2 :                                 ast_debug(1, "Got a new subscription %s (possibly with auth) or retransmission\n", p->callid);
   28463             :                 }
   28464             :         }
   28465             : 
   28466             :         /* Check if we have a global disallow setting on subscriptions.
   28467             :                 if so, we don't have to check peer settings after auth, which saves a lot of processing
   28468             :         */
   28469          18 :         if (!sip_cfg.allowsubscribe) {
   28470           0 :                 transmit_response(p, "403 Forbidden (policy)", req);
   28471           0 :                 pvt_set_needdestroy(p, "forbidden");
   28472           0 :                 return 0;
   28473             :         }
   28474             : 
   28475          30 :         if (!req->ignore && !resubscribe) {  /* Set up dialog, new subscription */
   28476          12 :                 const char *to = sip_get_header(req, "To");
   28477             :                 char totag[128];
   28478          12 :                 set_pvt_allowed_methods(p, req);
   28479             : 
   28480             :                 /* Check to see if a tag was provided, if so this is actually a resubscription of a dialog we no longer know about */
   28481          12 :                 if (!ast_strlen_zero(to) && gettag(req, "To", totag, sizeof(totag))) {

   28858             : /*! \brief Handle incoming REGISTER request */
   28859          61 : static int handle_request_register(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *req, struct ast_sockaddr *addr, const char *e)

   28861             :         enum check_auth_result res;
   28862             : 
   28863             :         /* If this is not the intial request, and the initial request isn't
   28864             :          * a register, something screwy happened, so bail */

   28866           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Ignoring spurious REGISTER with Call-ID: %s\n", p->callid);
   28867           0 :                 return -1;
   28868             :         }
   28869             : 
   28870             :         /* Use this as the basis */
   28871          61 :         copy_request(&p->initreq, req);
   28872          61 :         if (sipdebug)
   28873          36 :                 ast_debug(4, "Initializing initreq for method %s - callid %s\n", sip_methods[req->method].text, p->callid);
   28874          61 :         check_via(p, req);
   28875             : 
   28876          61 :         if ((res = register_verify(p, addr, req, e)) < 0) {
   28877             :                 const char *reason;
   28878             : 
   28879          12 :                 switch (res) {
   28880           4 :                 case AUTH_SECRET_FAILED:
   28881           4 :                         reason = "Wrong password";
   28882           4 :                         break;
   28883           0 :                 case AUTH_USERNAME_MISMATCH:
   28884           0 :                         reason = "Username/auth name mismatch";
   28885           0 :                         break;
   28886           0 :                 case AUTH_NOT_FOUND:
   28887           0 :                         reason = "No matching peer found";
   28888           0 :                         break;
   28889           8 :                 case AUTH_UNKNOWN_DOMAIN:
   28890           8 :                         reason = "Not a local domain";
   28891           8 :                         break;
   28892           0 :                 case AUTH_PEER_NOT_DYNAMIC:

   29243             : /*! \brief Read data from SIP UDP socket
   29244             : \note sipsock_read locks the owner channel while we are processing the SIP message

   29246             : \note Successful messages is connected to SIP call and forwarded to handle_incoming()

   29288             : 
   29289             : /*! \brief Handle incoming SIP message - request or response
   29290             : 
   29291             :         This is used for all transports (udp, tcp and tcp/tls)
   29292             : */
   29293        2828 : static int handle_request_do(struct sip_request *req, struct ast_sockaddr *addr)
   29294             : {
   29295             :         struct sip_pvt *p;
   29296        2828 :         struct ast_channel *owner_chan_ref = NULL;
   29297        2828 :         int recount = 0;
   29298        2828 :         int nounlock = 0;
   29299             :

   29301        2021 :                 req->debug = 1;
   29302        2828 :         if (sip_cfg.pedanticsipchecking)
   29303        2808 :                 lws2sws(req->data);  /* Fix multiline headers */
   29304        2828 :         if (req->debug) {
   29305        2021 :                 ast_verbose("\n<--- SIP read from %s:%s --->\n%s\n<------------->\n",
   29306             :                         sip_get_transport(req->socket.type), ast_sockaddr_stringify(addr), ast_str_buffer(req->data));
   29307             :         }
   29308             : 
   29309        2828 :         if (parse_request(req) == -1) { /* Bad packet, can't parse */
   29310           0 :                 ast_str_reset(req->data); /* nulling this out is NOT a good idea here. */
   29311           0 :                 return 1;
   29312             :         }
   29313        2828 :         req->method = find_sip_method(REQ_OFFSET_TO_STR(req, rlpart1));
   29314             :

   29316        2021 :                 ast_verbose("--- (%d headers %d lines)%s ---\n", req->headers, req->lines, (req->headers + req->lines == 0) ? " Nat keepalive" : "");

   29745             : /*! \brief Sends a session timeout channel blob used to produce SessionTimeout AMI messages */

   29747             : {

   29760             : 
   29761             : /*!

   30092             : /* Run by the sched thread. */
   30093         660 : static int __start_session_timer(const void *data)
   30094             : {
   30095         660 :         struct sip_pvt *pvt = (void *) data;
   30096         660 :         struct sip_st_dlg *stimer = pvt->stimer;
   30097             :         unsigned int timeout_ms;
   30098             : 
   30099             :         /*
   30100             :          * RFC 4028 Section 10
   30101             :          * If the side not performing refreshes does not receive a
   30102             :          * session refresh request before the session expiration, it SHOULD send
   30103             :          * a BYE to terminate the session, slightly before the session
   30104             :          * expiration.  The minimum of 32 seconds and one third of the session
   30105             :          * interval is RECOMMENDED.
   30106             :          */
   30107             : 
   30108         660 :         timeout_ms = (1000 * stimer->st_interval);
   30109         660 :         if (stimer->st_ref == SESSION_TIMER_REFRESHER_US) {
   30110         347 :                 timeout_ms /= 2;
   30111             :         } else {
   30112         313 :                 timeout_ms -= MIN(timeout_ms / 3, 32000);
   30113             :         }
   30114             : 
   30115             :         /* in the event a timer is already going, stop it */
   30116         660 :         do_stop_session_timer(pvt);
   30117             : 
   30118         660 :         dialog_ref(pvt, "Schedule session timer st_schedid");
   30119         660 :         stimer->st_schedid = ast_sched_add(sched, timeout_ms, proc_session_timer, pvt);
   30120         660 :         if (stimer->st_schedid < 0) {
   30121           0 :                 dialog_unref(pvt, "Failed to schedule session timer st_schedid");
   30122             :         } else {
   30123         660 :                 ast_debug(2, "Session timer started: %d - %s %ums\n",
   30124             :                         stimer->st_schedid, pvt->callid, timeout_ms);
   30125             :         }
   30126             : 
   30127         660 :         dialog_unref(pvt, "Start session timer action");
   30128         660 :         return 0;
   30129             : }
   30130             :

   30224             : 
   30225             : /*! \brief Handle 422 response to INVITE with session-timer requested
   30226             : 
   30227             :    Session-Timers:   An INVITE originated by Asterisk that asks for session-timers support
   30228             :    from the UAS can result into a 422 response. This is how a UAS or an intermediary proxy
   30229             :    server tells Asterisk that the session refresh interval offered by Asterisk is too low
   30230             :    for them.  The proc_422_rsp() function handles a 422 response.  It extracts the Min-SE
   30231             :    header that comes back in 422 and sends a new INVITE accordingly. */
   30232           4 : static void proc_422_rsp(struct sip_pvt *p, struct sip_request *rsp)
   30233             : {
   30234             :         int rtn;
   30235             :         const char *p_hdrval;
   30236             :         int minse;
   30237             : 
   30238           4 :         p_hdrval = sip_get_header(rsp, "Min-SE");
   30239           4 :         if (ast_strlen_zero(p_hdrval)) {
   30240           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "422 response without a Min-SE header %s\n", p_hdrval);
   30241           0 :                 return;
   30242             :         }
   30243           4 :         rtn = parse_minse(p_hdrval, &minse);
   30244           4 :         if (rtn != 0) {
   30245           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Parsing of Min-SE header failed %s\n", p_hdrval);
   30246           0 :                 return;
   30247             :         }
   30248           4 :         p->stimer->st_cached_min_se = minse;
   30249           4 :         if (p->stimer->st_interval < minse) {
   30250           4 :                 p->stimer->st_interval = minse;
   30251             :         }
   30252           4 :         transmit_invite(p, SIP_INVITE, 1, 2, NULL);
   30253             : }

   30438             : 
   30439             : /*! \brief Check availability of peer, also keep NAT open
   30440             : \note   This is done with 60 seconds between each ping,
   30441             :         unless forced by cli or manager. If peer is unreachable,
   30442             :         we check every 10th second by default.
   30443             : \note Do *not* hold a pvt lock while calling this function.
   30444             :         This function calls sip_alloc, which can cause a deadlock
   30445             :         if another sip_pvt is held.

   30540             : 
   30541             : /*! \brief Part of PBX channel interface
   30542             : \note
   30543             : \par    Return values:---
   30544             : 
   30545             :         If we have qualify on and the device is not reachable, regardless of registration
   30546             :         state we return AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE
   30547             : 
   30548             :         For peers with call limit:
   30549             :                 - not registered                        AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE
   30550             :                 - registered, no call                   AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE
   30551             :                 - registered, active calls              AST_DEVICE_INUSE
   30552             :                 - registered, call limit reached        AST_DEVICE_BUSY
   30553             :                 - registered, onhold                    AST_DEVICE_ONHOLD
   30554             :                 - registered, ringing                   AST_DEVICE_RINGING
   30555             : 
   30556             :         For peers without call limit:
   30557             :                 - not registered                        AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE
   30558             :                 - registered                            AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE
   30559             :                 - fixed IP (!dynamic)                   AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE
   30560             : 
   30561             :         Peers that does not have a known call and can't be reached by OPTIONS
   30562             :                 - unreachable                           AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE
   30563             : 
   30564             :         If we return AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN, the device state engine will try to find
   30565             :         out a state by walking the channel list.
   30566             : 
   30567             :         The queue system (\ref app_queue.c) treats a member as "active"
   30568             :         if devicestate is != AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILBALE && != AST_DEVICE_INVALID
   30569             : 
   30570             :         When placing a call to the queue member, queue system sets a member to busy if
   30571             :         != AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE and != AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN
   30572             : 
   30573             : */
   30574        1772 : static int sip_devicestate(const char *data)
   30575             : {
   30576             :         char *host;
   30577             :         char *tmp;
   30578             :         struct sip_peer *p;
   30579             : 
   30580        1772 :         int res = AST_DEVICE_INVALID;
   30581             : 
   30582             :         /* make sure data is not null. Maybe unnecessary, but better be safe */
   30583        1772 :         host = ast_strdupa(data ? data : "");
   30584        1772 :         if ((tmp = strchr(host, '@')))
   30585           0 :                 host = tmp + 1;
   30586             : 
   30587        1772 :         ast_debug(3, "Checking device state for peer %s\n", host);
   30588             : 
   30589             :         /* If sip_find_peer asks for a realtime peer, then this breaks rtautoclear.  This
   30590             :          * is because when a peer tries to autoexpire, the last thing it does is to
   30591             :          * queue up an event telling the system that the devicestate has changed
   30592             :          * (presumably to unavailable).  If we ask for a realtime peer here, this would
   30593             :          * load it BACK into memory, thus defeating the point of trying to clear dead
   30594             :          * hosts out of memory.
   30595             :          */
   30596        1772 :         if ((p = sip_find_peer(host, NULL, FALSE, FINDALLDEVICES, TRUE, 0))) {
   30597        1691 :                 if (!(ast_sockaddr_isnull(&p->addr) && ast_sockaddr_isnull(&p->defaddr))) {
   30598             :                         /* we have an address for the peer */
   30599             : 
   30600             :                         /* Check status in this order
   30601             :                                 - Hold
   30602             :                                 - Ringing
   30603             :                                 - Busy (enforced only by call limit)
   30604             :                                 - Inuse (we have a call)
   30605             :                                 - Unreachable (qualify)
   30606             :                            If we don't find any of these state, report AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE
   30607             :                            for registered devices */
   30608             : 
   30609        3156 :                         if (p->onhold)
   30610             :                                 /* First check for hold or ring states */
   30611           0 :                                 res = AST_DEVICE_ONHOLD;
   30612        1578 :                         else if (p->ringing) {
   30613           0 :                                 if (p->ringing == p->inuse)
   30614           0 :                                         res = AST_DEVICE_RINGING;
   30615             :                                 else
   30616           0 :                                         res = AST_DEVICE_RINGINUSE;
   30617        1578 :                         } else if (p->call_limit && (p->inuse == p->call_limit))
   30618             :                                 /* check call limit */
   30619           0 :                                 res = AST_DEVICE_BUSY;
   30620        1578 :                         else if (p->call_limit && p->busy_level && p->inuse >= p->busy_level)
   30621             :                                 /* We're forcing busy before we've reached the call limit */
   30622           0 :                                 res = AST_DEVICE_BUSY;
   30623        1578 :                         else if (p->call_limit && p->inuse)
   30624             :                                 /* Not busy, but we do have a call */
   30625           0 :                                 res = AST_DEVICE_INUSE;
   30626        1578 :                         else if (p->maxms && ((p->lastms > p->maxms) || (p->lastms < 0)))
   30627             :                                 /* We don't have a call. Are we reachable at all? Requires qualify= */
   30628           0 :                                 res = AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE;
   30629             :                         else    /* Default reply if we're registered and have no other data */
   30630        1578 :                                 res = AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE;
   30631             :                 } else {
   30632             :                         /* there is no address, it's unavailable */
   30633         113 :                         res = AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE;
   30634             :                 }
   30635        1691 :                 sip_unref_peer(p, "sip_unref_peer, from sip_devicestate, release ref from sip_find_peer");
   30636             :         }
   30637             : 
   30638        1772 :         return res;
   30639             : }
   30640             : 
   30641             : /*! \brief PBX interface function -build SIP pvt structure
   30642             :  *      SIP calls initiated by the PBX arrive here.
   30643             :  *
   30644             :  * \verbatim
   30645             :  *      SIP Dial string syntax:
   30646             :  *              SIP/devicename
   30647             :  *      or      SIP/username@domain (SIP uri)
   30648             :  *      or      SIP/username[:password[:md5secret[:authname[:transport]]]]@host[:port]
   30649             :  *      or      SIP/devicename/extension
   30650             :  *      or      SIP/devicename/extension/IPorHost
   30651             :  *      or      SIP/username@domain//IPorHost
   30652             :  *      and there is an optional [!dnid] argument you can append to alter the
   30653             :  *      To: header. And after that, a [![fromuser][@fromdomain]] argument.
   30654             :  *      Leave those blank to use the defaults.
   30655             :  * \endverbatim
   30656             :  */

   31460             : /*! \todo document this function */
   31461           1 : static void add_peer_mailboxes(struct sip_peer *peer, const char *value)
   31462             : {
   31463             :         char *next;
   31464             :         char *mbox;
   31465             : 
   31466           1 :         next = ast_strdupa(value);
   31467             : 
   31468           2 :         while ((mbox = strsep(&next, ","))) {
   31469             :                 struct sip_mailbox *mailbox;
   31470           1 :                 int duplicate = 0;
   31471             : 
   31472             :                 /* remove leading/trailing whitespace from mailbox string */
   31473           1 :                 mbox = ast_strip(mbox);
   31474           1 :                 if (ast_strlen_zero(mbox)) {
   31475           0 :                         continue;
   31476             :                 }
   31477             :

   33985             : /*! \brief Remove SIP headers added previously with SipAddHeader application */
   33986           0 : static int sip_removeheader(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *data)
   33987             : {
   33988             :         struct ast_var_t *newvariable;

   33991           0 :         char *inbuf = (char *) data;
   33992             :

   33994           0 :                 removeall = 1;
   33995             :         }
   33996           0 :         ast_channel_lock(chan);
   33997             : 
   33998           0 :         headp=ast_channel_varshead(chan);
   33999           0 :         AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN (headp, newvariable, entries) {

   34001           0 :                         if (removeall || (!strncasecmp(ast_var_value(newvariable),inbuf,strlen(inbuf)))) {

   34004             :                                                 ast_var_value(newvariable),

   34373             : /*!

   34378        1762 : static int peer_iphash_cb(const void *obj, const int flags)
   34379             : {
   34380        1762 :         const struct sip_peer *peer = obj;
   34381        1762 :         int ret = 0;

   34383        1762 :         if (ast_sockaddr_isnull(&peer->addr)) {
   34384           0 :                 ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Empty address\n");
   34385             :         }
