   34387        1762 :         ret = ast_sockaddr_hash(&peer->addr);
   34388             : 
   34389        1762 :         if (ret < 0) {
   34390           0 :                 ret = -ret;
   34391             :         }
   34392             : 
   34393        1762 :         return ret;
   34394             : }
   34395             : 
   34396             : /*!
   34397             :  * Match Peers by IP and Port number.
   34398             :  *
   34399             :  * This function has two modes.
   34400             :  *  - If the peer arg does not have INSECURE_PORT set, then we will only return
   34401             :  *    a match for a peer that matches both the IP and port.
   34402             :  *  - If the peer arg does have the INSECURE_PORT flag set, then we will only
   34403             :  *    return a match for a peer that matches the IP and has insecure=port
   34404             :  *    in its configuration.
   34405             :  *
   34406             :  * This callback will be used twice when doing peer matching.  There is a first
   34407             :  * pass for full IP+port matching, and a second pass in case there is a match
   34408             :  * that meets the insecure=port criteria.
   34409             :  *
   34410             :  * \note Connections coming in over TCP or TLS should never be matched by port.
   34411             :  *
   34412             :  * \note the peer's addr struct provides to fields combined to make a key: the sin_addr.s_addr and sin_port fields.
   34413             :  */
   34414        1822 : static int peer_ipcmp_cb_full(void *obj, void *arg, void *data, int flags)
   34415             : {
   34416        1822 :         struct sip_peer *peer = obj, *peer2 = arg;
   34417        1822 :         char *callback = data;
   34418             : 
   34419        1822 :         if (!ast_strlen_zero(callback) && strcasecmp(peer->callback, callback)) {
   34420             :                 /* We require a callback extension match, but don't have one */
   34421         708 :                 return 0;
   34422             :         }
   34423             : 
   34424             :         /* At this point, we match the callback extension if we need to. Carry on. */
   34425             : 
   34426        1114 :         if (ast_sockaddr_cmp_addr(&peer->addr, &peer2->addr)) {
   34427             :                 /* IP doesn't match */
   34428           0 :                 return 0;
   34429             :         }
   34430             : 
   34431             :         /* We matched the IP, check to see if we need to match by port as well. */
   34432        1114 :         if (((peer->transports & peer2->transports) &
   34433         908 :                 (AST_TRANSPORT_UDP | AST_TRANSPORT_WS | AST_TRANSPORT_WSS)) &&
   34434         908 :                 ast_test_flag(&peer2->flags[0], SIP_INSECURE_PORT)) {
   34435             :                 /* We are allowing match without port for peers configured that
   34436             :                  * way in this pass through the peers. */
   34437         182 :                 return ast_test_flag(&peer->flags[0], SIP_INSECURE_PORT) ?
   34438         182 :                                 (CMP_MATCH | CMP_STOP) : 0;
   34439             :         }
   34440             : 
   34441             :         /* Now only return a match if the port matches, as well. */
   34442         932 :         return ast_sockaddr_port(&peer->addr) == ast_sockaddr_port(&peer2->addr) ?
   34443         932 :                         (CMP_MATCH | CMP_STOP) : 0;
   34444             : }
   34445             : 
   34446           0 : static int peer_ipcmp_cb(void *obj, void *arg, int flags)
   34447             : {
   34448           0 :         return peer_ipcmp_cb_full(obj, arg, NULL, flags);
   34449             : }

   34500             : 
   34501           8 :         switch (flags & OBJ_SEARCH_MASK) {
   34502           4 :         case OBJ_SEARCH_KEY:
   34503           4 :                 key = obj;
   34504           4 :                 break;
   34505           4 :         case OBJ_SEARCH_OBJECT:
   34506           4 :                 object = obj;
   34507           4 :                 key = object->configvalue;
   34508           4 :                 break;
   34509           0 :         default:
   34510             :                 /* Hash can only work on something with a full key. */
   34511           0 :                 ast_assert(0);
   34512           0 :                 return 0;
   34513             :         }
   34514           8 :         return ast_str_hash(key);
   34515             : }
   34516             : 
   34517           0 : static int registry_cmp_cb(void *obj, void *arg, int flags)
   34518             : {
   34519           0 :         const struct sip_registry *object_left = obj;
   34520           0 :         const struct sip_registry *object_right = arg;
   34521           0 :         const char *right_key = arg;
   34522             :         int cmp;
   34523             : 
   34524           0 :         switch (flags & OBJ_SEARCH_MASK) {
   34525           0 :         case OBJ_SEARCH_OBJECT:
   34526           0 :                 right_key = object_right->configvalue;
   34527             :                 /* Fall through */
   34528           0 :         case OBJ_SEARCH_KEY:
   34529           0 :                 cmp = strcmp(object_left->configvalue, right_key);
   34530           0 :                 break;
   34531           0 :         default:
   34532           0 :                 cmp = 0;
   34533           0 :                 break;
   34534             :         }
   34535           0 :         if (cmp) {
   34536           0 :                 return 0;
   34537             :         }
   34538           0 :         return CMP_MATCH;
   34539             : }

   34758             : 
   34759             : /*!
   34760             :  * \brief Imitation TCP reception loop
   34761             :  *
   34762             :  * This imitates the logic used by SIP's TCP code. Its purpose
   34763             :  * is to either
   34764             :  * 1) Combine fragments into a single message
   34765             :  * 2) Break up combined messages into single messages
   34766             :  *
   34767             :  * \param fragments The message fragments. This simulates the data received on a TCP socket.
   34768             :  * \param num_fragments This indicates the number of fragments to receive
   34769             :  * \param overflow This is a place to stash extra data if more than one message is received
   34770             :  *        in a single fragment
   34771             :  * \param[out] messages The parsed messages are placed in this array
   34772             :  * \param[out] num_messages The number of messages that were parsed
   34773             :  * \param test Used for printing messages
   34774             :  * \retval 0 Success
   34775             :  * \retval -1 Failure
   34776             :  */
   34777          11 : static int mock_tcp_loop(char *fragments[], size_t num_fragments,
   34778             :                 struct ast_str **overflow, char **messages, int *num_messages, struct ast_test* test)
   34779             : {
   34780             :         struct ast_str *req_data;
   34781          11 :         int i = 0;
   34782          11 :         int res = 0;
   34783             : 
   34784          11 :         req_data = ast_str_create(128);
   34785          11 :         ast_str_reset(*overflow);
   34786             : 
   34787          25 :         while (i < num_fragments || ast_str_strlen(*overflow) > 0) {
   34788          14 :                 enum message_integrity message_integrity = MESSAGE_FRAGMENT;
   34789          14 :                 ast_str_reset(req_data);
   34790          33 :                 while (message_integrity == MESSAGE_FRAGMENT) {
   34791          19 :                         if (ast_str_strlen(*overflow) > 0) {
   34792           3 :                                 ast_str_append(&req_data, 0, "%s", ast_str_buffer(*overflow));
   34793           3 :                                 ast_str_reset(*overflow);
   34794             :                         } else {
   34795          16 :                                 ast_str_append(&req_data, 0, "%s", fragments[i++]);
   34796             :                         }
   34797          19 :                         message_integrity = check_message_integrity(&req_data, overflow);
   34798             :                 }
   34799          14 :                 if (strcmp(ast_str_buffer(req_data), messages[*num_messages])) {
   34800           0 :                         ast_test_status_update(test, "Mismatch in SIP messages.\n");
   34801           0 :                         ast_test_status_update(test, "Expected message:\n%s", messages[*num_messages]);
   34802           0 :                         ast_test_status_update(test, "Parsed message:\n%s", ast_str_buffer(req_data));
   34803           0 :                         res = -1;
   34804           0 :                         goto end;
   34805             :                 } else {
   34806          14 :                         ast_test_status_update(test, "Successfully read message:\n%s", ast_str_buffer(req_data));
   34807             :                 }
   34808          14 :                 (*num_messages)++;
   34809             :         }
   34810             : 
   34811          11 : end:
   34812          11 :         ast_free(req_data);
   34813          11 :         return res;
   34814             : };
   34815             : 
   34816         561 : AST_TEST_DEFINE(test_tcp_message_fragmentation)
   34817             : {
   34818             :         /* Normal single message in one fragment */
   34819         561 :         char *normal[] = {
   34820             :                 "INVITE sip:bob@example.org SIP/2.0\r\n"
   34821             :                 "Via: SIP/2.0/TCP 127.0.0.1:5060;branch=[branch]\r\n"
   34822             :                 "From: sipp <sip:127.0.0.1:5061>;tag=12345\r\n"
   34823             :                 "To: <sip:bob@example.org:5060>\r\n"
   34824             :                 "Call-ID: 12345\r\n"
   34825             :                 "CSeq: 1 INVITE\r\n"
   34826             :                 "Contact: sip:127.0.0.1:5061\r\n"
   34827             :                 "Max-Forwards: 70\r\n"
   34828             :                 "Content-Type: application/sdp\r\n"
   34829             :                 "Content-Length: 130\r\n"

   34831             :                 "v=0\r\n"
   34832             :                 "o=user1 53655765 2353687637 IN IP4 127.0.0.1\r\n"
   34833             :                 "s=-\r\n"
   34834             :                 "c=IN IP4 127.0.0.1\r\n"
   34835             :                 "t=0 0\r\n"
   34836             :                 "m=audio 10000 RTP/AVP 0\r\n"
   34837             :                 "a=rtpmap:0 PCMU/8000\r\n"

   34922             :                 "Via: SIP/2.0/TCP 127.0.0.1:5060;branch=[branch]\r\n"
   34923             :                 "From: sipp <sip:127.0.0.1:5061>;tag=12345\r\n"

   35236         561 : AST_TEST_DEFINE(get_in_brackets_const_test)
   35237             : {
   35238             :         const char *input;
   35239         561 :         const char *start = NULL;
   35240         561 :         int len = 0;
   35241             :         int res;
   35242             : 
   35243             : #define CHECK_RESULTS(in, expected_res, expected_start, expected_len)   do {    \
   35244             :                 input = (in);                                           \
   35245             :                 res = get_in_brackets_const(input, &start, &len);       \
   35246             :                 if ((expected_res) != res) {                            \
   35247             :                         ast_test_status_update(test, "Unexpected result: %d != %d\n", expected_res, res); \
   35248             :                         return AST_TEST_FAIL;                           \
   35249             :                 }                                                       \
   35250             :                 if ((expected_start) != start) {                        \
   35251             :                         const char *e = expected_start ? expected_start : "(null)"; \
   35252             :                         const char *a = start ? start : "(null)";     \
   35253             :                         ast_test_status_update(test, "Unexpected start: %s != %s\n", e, a); \
   35254             :                         return AST_TEST_FAIL;                           \
   35255             :                 }                                                       \
   35256             :                 if ((expected_len) != len) {                            \
   35257             :                         ast_test_status_update(test, "Unexpected len: %d != %d\n", expected_len, len); \
   35258             :                         return AST_TEST_FAIL;                           \
   35259             :                 }                                                       \
   35260             :         } while(0)
   35261             : 
   35262         561 :         switch (cmd) {
   35263         560 :         case TEST_INIT:
   35264         560 :                 info->name = __func__;
   35265         560 :                 info->category = "/channels/chan_sip/";
   35266         560 :                 info->summary = "get_in_brackets_const test";
   35267         560 :                 info->description =
   35268             :                         "Tests the get_in_brackets_const function";
   35269         560 :                 return AST_TEST_NOT_RUN;
   35270           1 :         case TEST_EXECUTE:
   35271           1 :                 break;
   35272             :         }
   35273             : 
   35274           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("", 1, NULL, -1);
   35275           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("normal <test>", 0, input + 8, 4);
   35276           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("\"normal\" <test>", 0, input + 10, 4);
   35277           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("not normal <test", -1, NULL, -1);
   35278           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("\"yes < really\" <test>", 0, input + 16, 4);
   35279           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("\"even > this\" <test>", 0, input + 15, 4);
   35280           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("<sip:id1@10.10.10.10;lr>", 0, input + 1, 22);
   35281           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("<sip:id1@10.10.10.10;lr>, <sip:id1@10.10.10.20;lr>", 0, input + 1, 22);
   35282           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("<sip:id1,id2@10.10.10.10;lr>", 0, input + 1, 26);
   35283           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("<sip:id1@10., <sip:id2@10.10.10.10;lr>", 0, input + 1, 36);
   35284           1 :         CHECK_RESULTS("\"quoted text\" <sip:dlg1@10.10.10.10;lr>", 0, input + 15, 23);
   35285             : 
   35286           1 :         return AST_TEST_PASS;
   35287             : }
   35288             : 
   35289             : #endif
   35290             : 
   35291             : static const struct ast_sip_api_tech chan_sip_api_provider = {
   35292             :         .version = AST_SIP_API_VERSION,
   35293             :         .name = "chan_sip",
   35294             :         .sipinfo_send = sipinfo_send,
   35295             : };
   35296             : 
   35297             : static int unload_module(void);
   35298             : 
   35299             : /*!
   35300             :  * \brief Load the module
   35301             :  *
   35302             :  * Module loading including tests for configuration or dependencies.
   35303             :  * This function can return AST_MODULE_LOAD_FAILURE, AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE,
   35304             :  * or AST_MODULE_LOAD_SUCCESS. If a dependency or environment variable fails
   35305             :  * tests return AST_MODULE_LOAD_FAILURE. If the module can not load the
   35306             :  * configuration file or other non-critical problem return
   35307             :  * AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE. On success return AST_MODULE_LOAD_SUCCESS.
   35308             :  */
   35309         560 : static int load_module(void)
   35310             : {
   35311             :         struct sip_peer *bogus_peer;
